description:
Honestly, if you love a solid coffee/espresso or baked good, just come here. You will be sorely remiss if you don't come here to experience the deliciousness that is everything about this spot from their beverages, food, overall ambiance, vibe, and decor.

Just come and see it for yourself, seriously.
author: Ashley L.

description:
I was visiting SF 2 weeks ago and came here for breakfast with my gf and her daughter; our experience was great. 

The place was easy to spot because it was very packed and the line went all the way around it. I got in the line while my gf and her daughter saved us a place to sit. 

My gf had the avocado toast w/ poached egg, which was great; the dish was fresh and tasty. I had the Belgian waffle w/ poached eggs, which was a delicious mix of sweet and savory. My gf's had the Belgian waffle w/ bacon, which was also very tasty. We also had some warm and fresh coffees and hot chocolate. 

The service was good and the ambiance nice. I don't usually go to coffee shops back home, but SF really knows how to do them. Also, much like everything else worth having here in SF, you will have to wait, so bring your patience. Other than that, I would recommend this place and look forward to returning.
author: Renzo I.

description:
Blue bottle is an awesome local coffee option. 

This location in particular is a bit hard to find. You have to turn right off of market street and turn left to get inside. You'll see the blue bottle logos in the window. It's not a great place to spend time or work, given that it has very few places to sit and isn't the best area. 

I'd recommend leaving ~10 min for your drink to be prepared. All that said, it is great coffee!
author: Tess G.

description:
Without fail, this Blue Bottle is always busy when I visit--which I think is a testament to how popular this coffee chain remains. Located in Mint Plaza, it is a relatively small cafe compared to their other sites. The volume of customers in a narrow space also makes it a cacophonous experience; if you are looking for a quiet place to chat or work, this place is NOT it. 

However, I've never been disappointed by the coffee quality, and the service is generally friendly and welcoming despite the long lines. If you are ordering an espresso-based drink, be prepared to wait for a bit if you are visiting during peak times. You can also sit in the nearby plaza if the cafe's tables are occupied. If shopping at the Westfield Mall has you feeling sleepy, this Blue Bottle is great for a pick-me-up or a small snack.
author: Keith H.

description:
Makes my top 3 coffee spots in SF!

It is on the corner of an alley way that bends; there's like two parking spots right outside, but they're often taken by people who work next door. Across the street, there's a huge parking structure you can pay for. Many types of public transport also converge around this part of downtown. 

It's very, very hip! Tall ceilings, bar seating, and a couple cute tables line the exterior. Their drip coffee is made to order, using a single funnel. It's on the smaller side, so I wouldn't come here to do work with a group. I'm pretty sure I made myself a WiFi hot spot too. 

Every single one of their pastries is DELICIOUS and pair beautifully with the bitter coffee. Their coffee is extremely caffeinated, the way it should be. I came in during this afternoon this time and ordered an affogato for the first time, along with some baked goods because I couldn't resist. The ice cream was walnut cream and surrendered nicely to the espresso notes. Will definitely return for coffee if I have an early morning in this area!
author: Navila H.

description:
If I could give this place 7 stars, I would! This particular location was 10 mins walking distance from our hotel and I had never had a chance to go to blue bottle when I lived in NYC. We decided to grab an early breakfast here.  While walking to it, the area seemed a little sketchy but we didn't feel unsafe. 
I got the cappuccino with their house made oat milk which  was recommended by Valerie (our cashier), the avocado toast and some type of sweet oat bread.
I told Valerie how it was my first time at blue bottle and how I have always wanted to try it. She was so nice about it and gave us our drinks complimentary as a gesture of appreciation for trying them out!
Customer service overall was stellar and so was the taste of food and drinks. Definitely going back!
Thank you Valerie for making taking our experience to the next level!
author: Sugandha M.

description:
I really love BB coffee and try to have it as often as possible.

After a long day of touring the city I needed caffeine and I needed it bad. The wifey and I had stopped in to grab some ice cream and I realized that coffee and ice cream may actually snap me out of how exhausted I was.

I opted for the New Orleans coffee. Wow. I learned I do not like chicory. No downgrade to them - I should stick with what I know and not branch out. I sucked it down anyways because I needed the jolt. The average stars is the location. I felt like the customer service was meh at best and the line took quite while. I assumed a location used to a tourism influx would handle the pressure of a line a tad better and more efficiently.

Thanks for the coffee - it did its job. I'll stick to ordering my normal. I'll also avoid this location if possible.
author: Sabrina B.

description: This is just a first impression and not a definitive experience. I wanted to get an iced tea so I went in line. They have 1 cashier and 2 baristas making drinks, so line went as fast as it could have. I was thinking though that iced tea would be the quickest to order, but nope. They don't cut corners with pitchers of already-brewed tea sitting in their fridge... They brewed loose green leaf tea and poured it over ice. I appreciate the craft, truly. But I find it to be a double-edged sword in my case, as I was in a hurry to catch the bus, so I left after getting my iced tea and realized as I was walking away that it's quite bitter than what I had hoped.
author: Jessica F.

description:
This is the first time I've been to Blue Bottles Coffee, and I have to say I am bit disappointed, maybe because I am not from San Francisco or because I had too much of a high expectation.

Inside the place, there is practically no place to sit down and to chill. The service is okay, and the environment is nothing special. As for the coffee, I can definitely taste the smoothness and the quality of coffee itself, but I would not say it is not my taste bud breaking quality. I tasted better, and I think the popularity definitely contributes to its perception and rating.
author: Bryant S.

description:
Over hyped coffee... Had heard a lot about this coffee shop. Paid 4.5 dollars for a below average cappuccino... Wasn't even hot enough.. asked the servers to heat it, they told me I  should ask for extra hot next time. Didn't know cappuccino is suppose to be on cooler side.
Anyway somehow gulped it down.. disappointing.
Sorry SF, NY beats you in the coffee game hands down. Blue bottle up your game pls.
author: Meghna S.

description:
Great coffee, huge tourist trap. I too came here as a tourist and it was jam packed. The coffee was great but if you are a local it's not the best place to relax and enjoy your coffee. 

The toast they serve was on giant bread which I guess could because it cost so much. 

Good place to grab coffee before you explore San Fran.
author: Najin K.

description: This is the only none disappointment so far in SF.  The coffee is still amazing, the baristas are well trained.  Cookie is good too.  LoL.  Definitely my daily treat while in SF
author: Ada H.

description:
I understand why Some of these scores are low but let me tell you why I think it's wrong.
The coffee taste is very good there laté art is impressive and they have some desserts for breakfast. What really sets them apart is food option. Not only do you have the coffee and the desserts, but this place has breakfast. I tried the avocado toast and it was amazing!! Came back the next day just for it. Give it a try, there are several throughout the city.
author: Hernan P.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of Blue Bottle coffee, but this location is a nice spot to catch up for coffee in the area.

This Blue Bottle is tiny, but there's indoor and outdoor seating, as well as additional seating in the Mint Plaza area.

One thing to note is that they will make your coffee 'for here' unless you specify that you want it in a to-go cup.
author: Shirley H.

description:
This location is small and lines are long but they move fast! 

Bench style tables with high stools are shared by patrons willing to sit elbow to elbow while sipping their fragrant brew and noshing on avocado toast or pastries.

While I wasn't enamored of the coffee, the brioche breakfast sandwich was hearty and yet very light and airy. Simple and delicious.

Very friendly table service makes this a step up from the location in the financial district.
author: Sharon H.

description:
The wait for your drink will be longer than your wait at Starbucks, but 100% worth!! The coffee is bomb. Quality is perfecto. I usually get an iced mocha! BEST I've ever had. Food choices look nice, although I've never had any of the food there.

Probably not the kind of place you can sit at all day and do work. No outlets that I saw. Definitely best for a casual visit for coffee. Otherwise, love the location. The 9/11 Memorial is right across the street. You can see it if you sit at the seats facing it along the windows. Great seat if you like people watching.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
I was staying nearby and needed a quick cup of coffee before running off to work. I found this coffee shop on Yelp and it was like an 8 min walk. I had left enough time before meeting my colleagues to run here quick. 
The line was out the door when I arrived so I decided to order what I thought, was going to be the quickest thing to get... A drip coffee. 

I legit thought they would turn around, fill a cup and hand it over to me. NOPE, I stood there for at least 15 min before I asked the barista if they had a drip coffee sitting there. Another girl apologized and said they fell behind and would be getting the drip going....

Literally...

d
r
i

by

d

i
p 

I had to wait for my coffee. At one point, I questioned if it was best I just abandon ship and walk out since I had people waiting for me. But after roughly 20 or so (more) minutes, I had my DRIP COFFEE! 

it was delicious but there is no excuse for that wait...
author: Michael P.

description:
I have to give five stars based on our excellent service and the coffee. 

Our son did not like his apricot bar. (It was moist and delicious btw), so the kind chef replaced it with toasted bread and jam.  This would be the norm at a restaurant, but this is a coffee house. Anyways, I didn't expect it and feel like this alone deserves 5 stars.   I don't think they get children here often, and the workers were very kind. 

The latte was beautiful, strong and flavorful. The avocado toast was a skip it. It had a lot of avocado, but I make it better at home.  The poached eggs were delicious.
author: Kat M.

description:
Classic great quality specialty coffee delivered in a nice quirky way. It is basic and a little noisy but it is all about the quality of the coffee here. Lines can be long but, it is worth the wait. They have some food items like oatmeal, avocado toast, cookies and some nice pastries but, again, it is all about the coffee.

Nice espressos and an eclectic array of drip coffees. The servers are as eclectic as the coffee options but they are very good at what they do.

I have been going here since about when they opened but, I still go out of my way to go here when in town.
author: Edward F.

description:
This coffee is bomb diggity. It's one of the best cups of just straight up black coffee that I've had in my short time in SF. 

It's almost a tad rich, but I mean that in a good way. A lot of roasts now are leaning lighter but this has a nice fullness to it, yet I could still put down about 20 more ounces than the cup size I got.

The crumble bar we got was not my fav, it was.. crumbly. I know, I know but this thing wouldn't stay together if you looked at it too long. 

All in all, a nice stop in SF and one I'll be back to next time around.
author: Adam S.

description:
This place is full of tourists and it is probably not a place you want to go if you are looking for a quiet coffee shop for a book and coffee time. 
The coffee itself is really good. I ordered affogatto. The espresso on ice cream just made my day. As for the food, they messed up my order so I got avocado toasts instead of egg toasts. 
The shop itself is noisy. No restroom inside. People working there are trying to help you but they are really busy
author: Echo L.

description: LOVE this place.  One of my favorite coffee spots in the City! The staff is friendly (especially the sweet Asian cashier with the awesome colorful fairy hair! =)), and the atmosphere is really warm & cozy.  The coffee is strong and so flavorful, and hands-down has the best Affogato you can find!!
author: Phan ..

description:
Tip: no plugs here.  Not a place to use laptop.  Though there's plugs inside the bar, the baristas are nice enough to let you use it.  

Latte is legit. Very smooth and flavorful though on the pricey side. Every hot drink will have designs on top.
author: Jacky K C.

description:
The place is okay

Every time I come by here the place has a crazy line!  I have tried it a few times and it is really just another coffee joint. Nothing super special worth the line. It is a nicer shop in a not so nice area so maybe that explains the line.Or maybe because it is around the corner from a Rec pot dispensary?
author: John J.

description: Every time I'm in the city (live in the north bay) I stop at one of their locations. Today was I believe on Mint St. Great coffee, friendly, nice atmosphere. Always great!
author: Judy K.

description: Love the Blue Bottle Coffee avocado toast for breakfast, especially with two poached eggs on the side. You know what they say - give me avocado toast or give me decaf. Avo toast or not avo toast - that is the question. Four score and avo toast to-go, our fathers brought forth on this counter a healthy breakfast, conceived in California, and dedicated to the proposition that all breakfasts are created for people. We the people of the United States, in order to enjoy a more perfect breakfast, do ordain and establish this avocado toast for the Bay Area. It is a far, far better breakfast that I eat than I have ever done; it is a far, far better toast that is my go-to than I have ever known. Try it. Enjoy it. Live it. And then make your history.
author: Michael S.

description: New Orleans Style Iced Coffee with almond milk is the best! This place is always pack, but the line move very quickly. Cute shop with high ceiling, can't say much about customer service. They take our order and hand over our coffee then they move on to the next customer, they work fast to keep the line moving.
author: Kristen K.

description:
Great and friendly staff. Coffee was so good, I want one of these guys in my city. 

I ordered a latte and it tasted on pint. The milk added was not sweet so you can still taste COFFEE. Hopefully next time I'm in San Francisco I will definitely stop by and get coffee.
author: Berj D.

description:
For serious coffee lovers only... And even if you are, you may still need assistance ordering. That said, I had the Giant Steps blend... it's so robust and aromatic that I was just as content cuddling the mug. It needed to cool a bit anyways. 

I'm going to be honest; past the coffee, I didn't understand anything else on the menue... so look it up or ask... and yes, the staff was SUPER helpful (and didn't laugh at me) all while making their brewed creations look like an artform. I'd adventurously try my hand at another cup when I can.
author: Erica H.

description: Fantastic coffee to get me going all day long! This place is a must stop whenever I come to SF. Pro tip: go early!
author: Irina G.

description: Every time I am in the city with my manager, we stop by here to fulfill our coffee cravings. Trust me when I say that the lines are out the door at this place. Don't try this place if you are in a rush, It's not a grab and go kinda place. You seriously have to wait long to get your coffee. Everything we got so far was amazing. I absolutely love their avocado toast. It's very yummy.  Their service is great. Try this place if you have time and looking for some good coffee
author: Fereen A.

description: Great coffee, good food, nice people, but it takes way longer than it should...
author: Alison M.

description:
I seriously don't know why this place is so highly reviewed. The drinks I had here tasted good to me but nothing special.  I tried their Macchiato, Caffe Latte, and Iced Coffee.  Not worth the price you're paying for a small cup of coffee but hey it's San Francisco, everything is expensive. 

You might be asking, why am I giving it a three when I'm not saying anything good about the coffee? It's because of their service! I went towards the end when they were about to close but they still were really friendly. They also gave me a couple of free Lemon Poppyseed which I thought was moist and delicious. 

I'd come back here if I was in the area, but don't expect anything special with their coffees.
author: Anthony L.

description: This place used to be great: fresh, wholesome  breakfast bowls and good coffee. Our most recent visit here reveals a significant change for the worse. They now have tiny, plastic breakfast bowls with numerous additives and their coffee is an oily dark roast. The coffee was the biggest disappointment. It's a slight step up from Starbucks coffee with bitter tones and a burnt aroma. I won't be returning, unfortunately. this place has now become a wasteland of coffee grounds in the bottom of the cup and as rough as the neighborhood in which it resides.
author: Christy M.

description:
The flagship location.  This is where the Blue Bottle movement all began.

There is always a line.  ALWAYS.  And, if you think you'll be able to find easy & close parking on mint...LOL.

That's funny.

Best strategy is to visit on foot, avoiding all parking drama.  This is rather easy, since Nordstrom is so conveniently located across the street, as is Westfield.  Nordstrom has valet, & the mission parking garage services Westfield.  Easy peasy.

Out of the coffee holy trinity (Blue Bottle, Four Barrel, Ritual), BB is still my favorite.  So many years & coffee shops later...just goes to show that the pioneers will always inspire competitors, but their lead & gold standard level are inextinguishable.

Why not 5 stars?  The bloody wait!  Which is why I prefer the ferry building location.  There's always a line there too, but it moves faster.  FYI.

4 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Too expensive,  shitty service, shitty coffee owned by a bullshit corporation. If you are gonna pay that much for coffee it should be good
author: Amber A.

description:
What I ordered: Oji, avocado toast
Visit date: April 29, 2018
First time? Yes.

So...I've never had Blue Bottle coffee before (other than in coffee ice cream!) so this was an exciting first. I ordered the Oji, a Japanese cold brew which I later learned is a really slow coffee making process. This would explain the super smooth nature of the beverage. I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I could get into oji. I also had the avocado toast which was below standard (the bread was a bit tough and burnt).

This location is on the smaller side but there are seats and places to stand, as well as some outdoor space.
author: Erin G.

description: Blue Bottle has very well crafted beverages. I enjoyed the espresso's bold yet smooth flavor a lot. I ordered the affogato when I came, and it was the perfect combination. The space was a bit cramped since there were a lot of people during the lunch hour rush, but other than that, great experience.
author: Emily Z.

description:
Came by for coffee the other day and it was a phenomenal experience! Tucked away in an alley half a block south from Market behind Nordstrom Rack. 

Ordered an Iced Mocha and it was excellent! Espresso was very smooth and the chocolate was a dark variety and wasn't too sweet. I love how they use huge ice cubes in the drink too!

 Staff was super nice too!
author: Derek S.

description:
I was in San Francisco for Dreamforce and I stumbled upon this gem during the stay. The Yelp reviews are no lies, this coffee place is one of my top 5 places and I instantly became a regular. I'm a Mocha girl and they know how to make it just perfect, not too bitter nor too sweet. 

The designs are soo cute! They were swamped every time I was there but the presentation remained flawless. 

What made this place my fave even more are the staff. Leon, Fisher and Maria were few that I engaged in conversations with and they were all incredibly friendly, cheerful and sweet. 

Definitely will miss this place and highly recommend to all. Till next time
author: Dia F.

description: The latte was pretty good, but I'm not used to coffee shops like this and I was a bit confused. It was too busy to get any help and ended up just saying "give me whatever's good".
author: Brianna L.

description: Used to go here all the time when I worked around here. My associates loved the coffee and I loved the ambiance and the hot chocolate.
author: Sunil R.

description: The New Orleans iced coffee was one smooth, not too sugary, delicious drink that gave me energy to dance until the wee hours of the morning. Blue Bottle was a very clean space with reclaimed wood and the coffee is some of the best in SF. I came in for a specific purpose and while I didn't try their coffee black (a small regret), I loved the New Orleans and just how balanced that cup was with the small amount of sweetness. Delicious!
author: Alex L.

description: Incredible stop for a quick bite and amazing coffee. The poached egg on toast could be my forever breakfast. Great taste, good service, clean dining area. A must have if in the area.
author: Kevin J.

description: The world renowned coffee shop. Iced latte was just ok and I was not sure why there are such a number of fans of Blue Bottle Coffee. Maybe it was its branding and the instagram? To me, the coffee was just ok and the atmosphere of the shop had nothing special. Probably one of the best instagram spots, though.
author: Justin C.

description:
Though it was kind of hard to find, the inside is nice and modern. We tried their caffé mocha,
belgian waffle, and their breakfast sandwich. Their food prices are a bit steep given their portions, but the breakfast sandwich didn't fail to disappoint - I would recommend that for anyone looking for something fulfilling on their menu.
author: Kiana T.

description:
This has got to be the most hipster coffee shop ever. Lol they have the slick coffee drips and like "minimalistic" seating. Trying to give off that sleek vibe. Hahaha overall i liked it a lot even though the menu is super empty. 

They have outdoor seating. Not a lot of seating indoors but that's a given since it's the bay area. My buddy did order an Americano and that did take a long time to get out for him. I ordered the new Orleans and that was aite and came out super fast.
author: Na X.

description:
Lines are not too shabby at this location and they move pretty fast when they are crowded. The baristas are nice and knowledgeable and are willing to help with any questions or preferences you have with your order. 

I'm your "straight up black coffee" kind of girl & like to enjoy a smooth roast with a punch at the end. I don't want it burnt or too bold and blue bottle definitely delivers that! I love their pour-over & enjoy watching it every time, never gets old for some reason, lol. Overall, it's a good cup of coffee although paying $5+ for a basic brew makes it a treat for days I can actually sit and enjoy it.
author: Bethany M.

description:
I love the way this Blue Bottle looks. It's got that fresh, bright, ultra-modern style to it that really draws people in. When I first walked in, the beautiful breakfast bar with the wacky drip coffee contraptions caught my eye immediately. 

However, I just can't get over how overpriced their menu items are. This is hipster coffee-and-breakfast at its prime: $9 for avocado toast and $5 for a caffe latte? Yikes, dude. My dwindling bank account cringed at that one. Don't get me wrong, the toast was delicious and the latte was strong (more on that later). But you really need to come financially prepared for this.

Smashed avocado on milk toast? Sign me up. This iteration comes with sprouted cilantro and what appears to be pickled radish, dusted generously with furikake. Let me just say now that the furikake makes the dish. I didn't taste much of the cilantro and found the radish too strong, but the furikake combined with the light citrus taste of lemon was delicious. It was a great accompaniment to the coffee, which certainly has sour notes. I vastly prefer a light roast with sweeter notes, but it was worth branching out.

The line continues to be ridiculous throughout the morning, so get ready to park your butt while you wait.
author: Gwen W.

description:
I really like coffees made by blue bottle. Very busy place but worth waiting. The atmosphere is nice and the staff is very friendly.
Been here many times for breakfast and really enjoyed everytime.
All in all great cups of coffee here.
author: Ellie S.

description:
The line up at this popular coffee joint is insane and the line moves extremely slow.  The cashiers may be too friendly as the line doesn't seem to move as they chit chat with everyone.  I prefer four barrel any other day for the coffee too.
Value 2/5
atmosphere 2/5
service 2/5
quality 2/5
8/20
author: Nina S.

description: Lines are very long but they love quick. Prices aren't bad, either. The cappuccino and hot chocolate are just gets. Service is friendly and store is clean.
author: Juan M.

description:
Absolutely ADORE blue bottle coffee!!
I always make it a point to stop in at one of their locations any time I visit San Francisco. 
The coffee is exceptional and the customer service is on par as well. 
They even sell bottled versions of their craft coffee in local supermarkets in California. 
Check it out! 
You won't be disappointed!
author: Karli D.

description:
Heard so much great things about Blue Bottle Coffee! 
I'm a lil bit of a coffee snob and I'm pretty impressed with the taste of their coffee. I ended up buying bags of coffee beans to give away to my friends and for myself! =D
We ordered an avocado toast and poached eggs with a tomato base sauce. Both were delicious. I wish we had one in Vegas!
author: Ricamae L.

description:
Americano Expresso 
Blue Bottle coffee Expresso, with a small dollop of foam. Ad a side of sparkling water.  Never had this before. 

To explain it, the expresso is bitter but only slightly, focused on the tip of your tongue, and taking a sip of the sparkling water causes the expresso to flood the sides of your tongue with a burst of coffee goodness. The bubbles cause the flavor of the coffee to flood your taste buds with the coffee goodness. I really like it.
author: Balinor I.

description:
Blue Bottle is quickly becoming one of my favorite spots to hit when I'm in San Francisco. I will mention that I am not a connoisseur of coffee. I look at other coffee shops as different experiences and do not compare them purely on coffee quality - because to be honest, every one has different preferences and varietals of coffee tastes. 

I was in need of coffee, per usual, and there was a Blue Bottle on Mint street nearby the parking garage (across Westfield Shopping Center) where I was heading towards. It was a quick 3-5 minute walk from the shopping center. It was a beautiful day in the financial district so I didn't mind the walk. The only caveat is the level of homelessness; and I don't mind the actual homeless population. But, the entire walk had lingering urine smell in the air, which was very unpleasant. Once we got to Blue Bottle the aroma of coffee was worth the walk. 

The store is very nice and the two large siphons are beautiful! This location was quite spacious and industrial looking. There is a good amount of seating. There are also two restrooms, which requires customers ask baristas for the code (that is also stated on the front doors).  

Cleanliness (5/5): The retail wall is very organized. The menu boards very clear and not confusing for customers. There was a team member cleaning the lobby and condiment bar when we were waiting for our coffee so the store was very clean. The restrooms were also clean-let's be honest, sometimes restrooms are disgusting! 

Customer Experience (5/5): I will admit, the cashier was not enthusiastic or overly perky. But, to the point of it he answered my question about the three types of cold brews offered, and they were responses I actually understood! Thank You! The transaction was easy enough. My cold brew was made first and we waited about 3 minutes for the second cold brew. I asked the barista if there was another cold brew being made. He quickly apologized and made the cold brew. He was friendly and didn't roll his eyes or was annoyed by my concern. Another THANK YOU! 

Service/Product Quality (5/5): We ordered the Three Africas and the Goji (Japanese) cold brews. The cashier described the Goji as being made with old coffee beans - you can definitely taste it! I'm used to drinking Starbucks' cold brew and these were quite different from Starbucks ... again, I'm not saying one is better than the other - they are very different experiences of cold brew. I didn't try the Three Africas but the cashier said it was the lighter roasts and my friend told me it was very light in flavor. The Goji had a tangy taste to it. It is also only served in 3oz (which the cashier did tell me) so it's a little on the pricer side.
author: Martin N.

description:
Decent coffee wayyy to much attitude.
Come here plenty of times and the coffee only comes in 2 sizes.
The baristas seem to be extra attentive to techie trash but not so much the ppl that make San Francisco. Asked a few question was met with eye rolls and snarkiness. Due to lack of coffee options near by at night I will prob put up with the douchey baristas and loser transplants.  Might accidently brake something tho just to further annoy them.
author: nancy w.

description:
I was looking for a local coffee place while I was walking in Market St, and this place showed it. It is hidden, but thanks to the phone GPS I did not get lost.

I ordered their filtered/distilled coffee. It unique, and has a bold sweet taste.

I wish this place can open another place to where I live!
author: Naser A.

description:
Industrial classroom, communal table (for us students), and 6 chairs facing the windows (for the naughty boys and girls).  Shelves and cabinets built alongside and behind the L-shape counter.  Behind said counter is where the magic happens.  The highest-tech coffee equipment that squeeze and juice beans of coffee.  Wonderful service by intelligent and service-oriented types, albeit tattooed and nose-ring wearing.

They open daily at 630am.  Sunday morning, I can tell you that a regular stream of folks saunter in.  By 8am, a line starts to form but you can still find a seat inside to sit.  By 830am, it's 15 deep and standing room only.  And, it gets worse.

$8 coffees!  How about $14 for a large?  Really?  Well, not all.  $3.75 and up for remarkable brews.  Everyone talks about the $4 New Orleans Iced Coffee, and yes, they appears worthy.

Colombian Limited Release [$4.75 for 8 oz, 4.5 stars] - sweet, dark, and robust, unlike any Colombian coffee I've ever had (it's not Yuban).  That, along with a thick spread of Avocado Toast [$9, 5.0 stars] and I was very happy (and awake).

They know what they're doing here, mixing science + service + quality quite successfully.  Sign me up.
author: Randy B.

description:
Let's talk about the most beautiful breakfast sandwich. Yes, I know this is a coffee joint but I started off my morning in need of allllll the carbs and even more of the bacon (Thanks Issabelle F. & Tequila).

The most friendly cashier took my order. I think he could sense my urgency for bacon because as I ordered the 17 ft. ceiling espresso & and breakfast sandwich he did a happy dance. No really, we shimmied together across the counter and my most perfect San Fransisco morning was born.

I'll start with the sandwich, because it made my day. Artfully crafted on a brioche bun this bad boy is filled with a fluffy egg frittata, thick cut heritage bacon, and arugula. It's soooo fluffy I could cry. The prefect bacon, egg, and bread ratio. Did I wish there was cheese. No. It was perfection as is. 

Moving right along to the 17 ft. Ceiling espresso. I drink my coffee black, so I did not add sugar to this little cup of greatness. This was STRONG. BUT I was surprised at for the strength it packed, how smooth it was.  Very impressed at this tiny little cup that kept me going all day!

The ambiance of the place is pretty zen, too. White walls, industrial feel and the most interesting coffee brewing equipment I have seen!

Will definitely be back to try other caffinated greatness on the menu next time in San Fransisco!
author: Diandra L.

description:
It is such a cute spot with indoor and outdoor sitting area. Great place to meet friends but wouldn't recommend it for work.
It's usually very crowded and loud.
If you like sweet coffee try the New Orleans with almond milk. It is delicious.
author: Sevda G.

description:
I made the mistake of coming here my first time and not ordering coffee. I know, those of you who know me are probably thinking "Issabelle? No coffee? What?", well, believe it friends, I surprisingly didn't have coffee one morning. But, it was the wrong morning to not have coffee, because that is Blue Bottle's specialty. 

So, what did I get if I didn't try their caffeinated concoctions? Their food of course. I had their breakfast sandwich with added avocado, and that was delicious! The bacon was perfectly crispy and the frittata eggs were on point. I snagged a bite from Brett N's poached eggs on toast and the bread tasted like a sweet cloud of pillows - fluffy and yummy. I'll have to get that with added avocado (of course) next time. 

The place itself is set up with simple and minimalistic decor -- white walls, high tops communal tables, plants, with a water and coffee topping station. We came in at the perfect time right before a line started forming out the door. This place can get pretty busy and packed quickly since it's fairly small. My suggestion? Sit at one of their communal spots (you don't really have another choice), make a friend, and talk about how good their food and coffee is. Or if you're with a group, come early and squeeze in to one of the few high-tops. 

I can see why so many locals and tourists love Blue Bottle. I'll most definitely be back when I'm in SF next. Next time though, to try their coffee.
author: Issabelle F.

description: I've been living in Seattle for a little over a year now and really miss blue bottle. It was my favorite coffee.
author: IP B.

description:
This place is as good as the hype. I got the New Orleans iced coffee per recommendation of the barista and was completely satisfied by the rec. The smoothness of the coffee and light yet hearty flavor was the perfect compliment. Not too sweet but soft and delicate..... if that is even a way to describe coffee.

To be honest, I'm not the snobbiest of coffee goers but I'd definitely come back for this one!  The location was easy to get too and not too crowded. There wasn't any wifi however....... maybe so loners and nerdy students like me won't stay for too long :P
author: April V.

description:
If it were at all possible to have a fountain of Blue Bottle Coffee's affogato installed in my front lawn, I would love it.  Their affogato was not only the cure to a little dehydration after travelling, but it was also some of the best affogato that I have ever had.  Even after the ice cream melted, turning it into more of a milkshake of sorts, the affogato was stuff of dreams.  I think I would be in trouble if I actually lived in San Francisco because I'd be making that my morning coffee every morning.

I didn't order anything else but my affogato, but everything that came floating from the kitchen smelled and looked absolutely amazing.  I'd have been tempted to double back and order some food except that it was unbelievably hot in the cafe...I was hard-pressed to wait for my affogato to be made - I could hardly stand sitting in and eating in the hot, hot heat.  Quite frankly, I'm surprised the workers weren't fatigued from the heat (or maybe they were and were just good at hiding it).  

But to get back to the workers - They were all very gracious and friendly people, pleasantly making conversation with us Chicagoans.  I have to say though, that the workers here were so friendly (which I'm totally not docking - it's always better be friendly) that they were making conversation with everyone and that caused for a great deal of congestion around the counter where there is already little standing room.  So yes, it is super crowded in this location of Blue Bottle Coffee (which is also why it's so hot probably) and I don't do well with super crowded spaces. 

The last point I want to touch on is something that I'm not docking the cafe for, but something that should be addressed: my fiance and I both work as substance use counselors and we noticed instantaneously a new girl being trained who was very evidently high on some sort of amphetamines.  It was obvious to us, and so too would be to an untrained eye - it looked like she was about to crawl out of her skin and she was visibly unable to concentrate.  That's not safe for her, the other employees or customere.  I hope this is resolved so she can get some help, and so that everyone who frequents the cafe is in good hands.
author: Lauren K.

description: Very good cappuccino and lattes. The wait wasn't too bad as we went in the evening. The snacks were so-so, maybe because we went in the evening. Overall a place for great coffee.
author: Nikunj P.

description:
Customer service is everything.  That is the driver behind my 3 stars.  I would give 3.5 if possible.  
The girl who took my order was not friendly.  In fact, she was downright condescending.  My husband was excited to take me here.  He knows my love for new coffee places, and he had seen this on TV and thought I'd love it.  It wasn't far from where we were staying, so we walked down there after a long night of music (Action Bronson) friends, drinks, food.  I was a little hungover, let's be real.  
So, my hungover, exhausted basic *ss self accidentally ordered a VANILLA latte.  I know they don't have flavors, most places like that don't.  BUT, vanilla latte is my go to, and I let it slip.  I think the whole place gasped and fell quiet as in slow motion the super hip girl behind the counter told me that they don't have flavors HERE.  Emphasis on here.  I should have turned around in shame and left.  But the line, the line was long.  I needed coffee.  I took my shame with a regular latte and 4 pack of cold brew.  $16 for 4 little cans.  I wanted to bring some crack coffee to my office mates.  
I waited for another 20 minutes for my coffee.  That was okay, I knew it would be a wait.  I'm not complaining.  It was a damn good coffee!  I mean, probably the smoothest coffee I have ever had.  Luke warm.  Is that a thing?  I couldn't finish it all because it just got so cold . . . .
So $21 later because I still tipped her . . .I had some cold brew and half a latte.  I made my way to Project Juice for satisfaction.
The cold brew was SO good.  I wish I had bought 2.  I got some serious work done the day I drank mine.  
With so many awesome coffee places, I probably won't be back, but I'm glad I went.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Can I say amazing coffee? You bet! Cafe Latte was truly delicious, just the right amount of milk (which is Organic, by the way, huge plus!), the right strength of coffee = perfection.

I also ordered an avocado toast, which was unique, but a bit oversalted. The toast itself was cut a bit thick to my liking and absolutely dry, but the topping of avocado et al. was pretty good. 

Finally, their Affogato (ice cream with some syrup in coffee) is amazingly delicious, but will worth you over 600 calories. I know, I know, I probably should shut up now...
author: Christy W.

description: Everything about this coffee shop is perfect. It's kind of hidden just in the outside of the Healy polished tourist Street. This hip coffee shop is vegan friendly. All employees were talkative and sweet, engaging in conversations! It made me feel welcome and at home. The coffee was a soy chai latte, and it was so great. I will definitely be back when I visit the then again.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I have stopped bothering going to any Blue Bottle Coffee locations (NYC, SF, LA) because every location I've been to had baristas who are experts at nothing but brewing under-extracted, incredibly sour cups of coffee, and unfortunately this one lives up to that disappointment.

Someone recommended their nel drip, saying it's the best they've had, so I thought to myself, sure, why not? And went there and ordered their $10 nel drip. I had to wait at least 15 minutes to get my order (mind you, this was an incredibly slow day), and you'd think they would be able to make a decent cup with that much time (total brewing time using a nel drip should be around 3m20s) but the cup was so sour it was undrinkable. 

It seems like the only training Blue Bottle Coffee gives to their baristas is to discard the brewing methods they have on their site, and to just rush everything no matter how under-extracted their brews end up being. 

Pro tip to anyone who wants a good cup of coffee: Go spend your money on better coffee establishments around SF, where baristas actually take their time to brew a good cup. Buy yourself a nel drip setup from Amazon (cheaper than the "kit" Blue Bottle has on their site) and brew a cup yourself, instead of wasting money on overpriced,  undrinkable sour coffee from Blue Bottle establishments.

Advice to this establishment: Train your baristas better, make them taste their brews so they'll realize how bad they are at making $10~ cups of coffee.
author: D A.

description: Great coffee, small space, no WiFi, limited seating, seemingly unlimited coffee selections. Had the cortado and a pour-over. Both were flavorful, rich and very satisfying. Location was a bit hard to find but well worth the search! Highly recommend for the coffee.
author: Joe S.

description:
This location of this Blue Bottle Cafe is in a scary area, in my opinion. My friends and I walked here from only a couple streets down, but encountered some scary situations. So I would definitely recommend Ubering or driving here if you wanted coffee.

The staff is extremely friendly, and once you're in the shop it is all peaceful again. But, I thought the coffee tasted strange. The ice coffee I ordered was sour! Maybe it's just not my type of coffee, but I prefer a more bitter taste rather than sour taste. 

If you like sour coffee, you can give this place a try. Otherwise, I would go to Starbucks to be safe.
author: Melody S.

description:
New Orleans Iced Coffee - YUM! 

Also, pro tip if you don't want to wait in line there's a cart right outside that serves cold brew, New Orleans, and 3 different kinds of hot coffee. Super convenient to grab and go!
author: Fahren F.

description:
So yummy! Worth every $5 I paid for the small latte! 

It's always so packed bc it's so good, they have standing room you can cram into but the idea isn't to stay forever/do work on your laptop there.  They don't have free WIFI so they can get you in and out. for a good reason.  They want to sell coffee and sell as many as they can!

Perfect cup of latte.
author: Christine J.

description: Had a nice latte here (very smooth and not bitter at all) which was well presented. There is often a wait and there isn't a ton of seating inside (we had to look for an extra stool to sit on for a few minutes). Also a tad bit overpriced but the coffee is stellar.
author: Shawn K.

description: Love Blue bottle coffee. Great cold brew and espresso's Friendly Staff very convient
author: Laurence K.

description:
I may not be a connoisseur of coffee. In fact, I feel like most of the coffee snobs that I know wouldn't be able to pass a blind taste test of what they said was the best coffee they have had and what the 10th best coffee they had. But what I do know is when I have had a great cup of coffee. And the coffee I have had from Blue Bottle, truly is a great one.

The reason I know this coffee is really good, is because they are bold enough to put some of it in milk cartons. Like the ones you used to get in elementary school. Like the ones that I got made of in elementary school because even on Friday (chocolate milk day) I still went with the regular old white milk. And even through these painful memories, drinking from this cardboard casing was still magnificent. In case you didn't follow my rambling, they put their coffee in a milk carton and refrigerate it.... and it is still delicious. And this is from a guy that doesn't really dig iced coffee. Which now in adulthood I am made fun of by my co-workers similar to my choc-milk days.

If you are near a Blue Bottle and craving some coffee, I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong.
author: Will B.

description:
While this place is tucked away, it doesn't stop the lines from being ridiculous.

Always assume the worst when you decide to get Blue Bottle. It will make it a pleasant surprise if the line isn't out the door. I've been here multiple times and there really isn't a rhyme or reason to when there's a long line. Obviously, the line will be long any given morning. However, come in at 2 pm and while you might not wait in line, by the time you get your coffee, the line will be out the door again.

However, Blue Bottle is delicious so if you have the time to spare, it's always worth it. I usually get an Almond Milk Latte, but you really can't go wrong with the drink options. Also +100 for the fact that you can order food at this location-- the avocado toast is delicious with the chunks of avocado and furikake!

I usually take my order to-go, but there is a decent amount of seating in the small shop. However, just like the line, the availability of the seating is hit or miss.
author: Angela C.

description: What a great place to grab a bite for breakfast and some coffee. Found that they were a great place to try while in San Fran and gave it a shot. Was well worth it! It was a short walk from the hotel, and tucked away a bit from the daily traffic. Service was great, coffee was good, and food was a good way to start the day. Will definitely go again if in the area, worth stoping by if you are in town!
author: Patrick W.

description:
A friend recommended this coffee shop before I came to San Francisco for a work trip. Definitely worth the short walk! The location is a hidden gem, once close enough I saw a line out the door so you know it's a good spot. I ordered my usual, a black coffee and a breakfast pastry. The guy at the register asked me: "how do you like to drink your coffee" and recommend a blend that would fit my palette and guaranteed I would like it. I loved the coffee, it was smooth and light. The pastry was a bacon scone, which was light and soft inside. 

Overall a great experience, great products and great service. I'd totally recommend!
author: Dillin R.

description:
Love the coffee, but the customer service can use some work. We used Lyft to get here from Fisherman's Wharf and when our driver missed the turn to get to Mint, we ended up in some shady alley. Then low and behold Blue Bottle. This location is small and very limited seating. I've had BB before, so my purpose was to buy some whole beans before heading back home to Southern CA. 

Walked in and no line. GREAT! I was looking at the whole beans and started asking questions with the guy behind the counter. What would have been helpful if there is a sign by the beans to tell you about the various blends and boldness. The dude spoke to quickly that I had to ask multiple questions. I decided on 2, and went to purchase. Then I ended up ordering the special brew (+$1 more) to go. My friend ordered the cold brew, and he got his order right away.

After several mins, I saw that other patrons got their orders before me and I stood at the counter waiting to see if perhaps the dude remembered that I ordered a drip. He was clearly in front of me and he only took my order a few mins ago. Then another guy comes up and asked my name. I stated my name and said that I only ordered a drip. He kindly apologized and handed me pastry saying that it was on him and said it would be a couple mins. Thanks for the service recovery, and no thanks to the dude that was standing next to you that didn't say a peep! 

Few mins passed, and I finally got my brew. Thank you for again apologizing for the mishap; however, staff should be more cognizant of their customers esp after you just took their order 5 mins ago. 

P.S. I'm still a fan of your coffee!
author: Maria C.

description:
It's worth coming to San Fran for Blue Bottle coffee alone! You can't go wrong with any coffee, made by any of the wide variety of brewing techniques. You can find a coffee to suit any mood, and give you the boost you need. I wanted to focus my review on Affogatto coffee. Blue Bottle serves a perfect ratio of smooth silky vanilla ice cream and strong aromatic espresso. The ice cream does not melt into coffee, nor do you run out of coffee and end up with a pile of ice cream in your cup. 
And if you think affogatto is just a dessert, come try one at Blue Bottle! By the time I was done with mine, I was awake, energized and ready for action like never before :)
author: Katherine G.

description: This place is amazing! My husband is really into coffee and wanted to go here for the siphon coffee. We got the Honduras one which was amazing. The process is so neat! My mocha was delicious and the breakfast was so good too. Only thing is don't expect it to be cheap!
author: Karin W.

description:
Not in the best location. It is tucked in the back in an alley that seemed very borderline shady. It's a very small shop with very little seating. But it probably was intended to be a grab and go. My friend asked a variety of questions about the coffee beans. They are very pricy! Half a pound of whole beans was $11.50, but it came highly recommended by my friend. So, gotta try it. The beans smelt very fragrant, so I hope they taste just as good as they smell. I also ordered a cold brew, which was in an 8oz cup for $4! Holy cow! I should have asked how big it was. And I asked for room for cream, so there was an inch of room on top! Cream and other condiments were out in the dining area and the trash is divided to  trash, compostable, and recyclable. The simple syrup was watered down, it took a bit to sweeten my brew. It was just an OK cup of cold brew. Not as bold as I would have liked it to be, but also had a slight berry flavor to it.

My friend was also waiting for her drip coffee. It took forever! They even served patrons that we're after us! No bueno! My time is just as valuable!
author: Antonio L.

description:
Came here looking for a good morning espresso based on reviews and left with a latte and two cookies (ginger molasses and snickerdoodle).
Staff was friendly, latte was average, not hot enough for my personal liking (I could easily chug it- would prefer it hot enough to sip over a decent amount of time), only one size available. The snickerdoodle cookie tasted nothing like a snickerdoodle- more like a vanilla cake batter cookie... no cinnamon sprinkle?  Ginger molasses was tasty.
author: Shauna L.

description: Came here around 6:30PM for the first time. Wanted to try their Kyoto coffee but they were out of it. I ended up ordering the New Orleans iced coffee. It was really good - just wished they offered more size options. Will try the Kyoto tomorrow morning.
author: Rome N.

description:
The times I've gone here the staff have always been incredibly friendly and helpful.  The prices are the same as other blue bottles and alright for San Francisco.  

The one gripe I have is the location.  There is 1 tiny sign on the outside of the building with the bottle logo, not even a name so the first time I went it was very hard to find.

The coffee is not too acidic, decently strong and smooth.  New Orleans iced coffee is my go-to
author: Nathan Y.

description:
This place is T-I-N-Y! It almost seems like it's hidden away from all the tourists in the Union Square area. Totally searchable if you're looking for coffee places on the Yelp app, though!

I actually do really like Blue Bottle and have a subscription to receive coffee from them every month, so it kind of saddens me to give this location only 3 stars. I couldn't help but notice the almond latte I normally order was a bit more pricey than their Berkeley and Oakland locations. Maybe because things tend to be more expensive in SF? I wouldn't mind if it wasn't for the fact that something was off with my drink. I think it tasted burnt? I can't quite put my finger on what was wrong, but it tasted different from what I usually get at other Blue Bottle locations.  The taste wasn't worth $6.

I don't know why it's hard for Blue Bottle to get wifi in their locations. There are other "hip" cafes in SF that don't have wifi either, but at least their lattes are better than what I got here. Service was great, but I just didn't like my drink. I think I would rather go to Starbucks if I need coffee in this area again. Blasphemy, I know....
author: Karen R.

description: Cool atmosphere. The cold brew has a distinct floral taste that I'm not a fan of though. The wait for a cappuccino during another visit was much longer than it should be (15+ minutes). It was good though!
author: Angela C.

description: If you don't mind dining with vagrants lingering nearby or even some trying to touch your food then come here! I consider myself a pretty strong woman but the number of homeless crack heads hanging out here and in the alley can make anyone feel uncomfortable. They will literally come inside the coffee shop touch your food, phones and be in your personal space. Aside from the crazies I ran into the coffee was decent. My mocha was was too chocolatey and I LOVE chocolate. I couldn't even taste the coffee flavor. Skip this and order a latte. I ordered the cute shaped avocado toast like I saw in the pictures here and got a plain cut bread. Truly disappointing for someone who likes to instagram her food. Even the latte art was a fail :/ The avocado toast had way too much lemon in it and the red pepper stuff they put on top should be on the side. The one item that was ridiculously delicious was their waffle! You don't even need butter or syrup as it seems to be cooked inside! Would definitely order this again. This place has so much potential but not worth coming back for me as I felt the safety of my children as well as myself truly compromised!
author: Diana A.

description: Just OK.  Really don't get the hype.
author: Dan O.

description: Great Breakfast in Blue Bottle coffee. The poached egg , avocado with toast are yummy. Signature drink Newolrean coffee is the best. Simple but delicious.
author: William C.

description:
This place has the best coffee!
Been to NYC location and this one and they are both great. Love their merch as well.
Had avocado toes and it was beautiful! recommend it.
author: Josefin F.

description:
It's in a bit of a sketchy area, but it's worth it for the coffee. The quality of both the hot and cold drinks are very good. This location is a little small, so I generally don't stay here (although it's always full of people working) and prefer to drink my coffee at Yerba Buena or somewhere else nearby. I've also noticed at times that it seems to get a little hot - not sure why or if that's just me.

This location is definitely the most convenient when you're downtown and need good coffee, but there are probably better coffee shops for working in. There's a reason Blue Bottle is well-known, though.
author: Joe B.

description:
This is one of the best Blue Bottle locations I have visited in San Francisco. They have a full serve menu including Siphon coffee and food. 

While we waited for our coffee, we talked with Stephen while he was making a Siphon coffee. He gave us (me, my wife and kids) an education about how siphon coffee works. We also asked him about pour over suggestions and he was very helpful. After he made the siphon coffee, he asked if we wanted a sample and we happily tried this amazing coffee! If you have extra time, make sure you have a siphon coffee.
author: Dave G.

description: Honestly don't get the hype :/ we got the New Orleans iced coffee and the avocado toast. Total amount spent was almost $15. We waited in a short line to order and hubby got a seat outside because it was way too crowded inside to find a seat. The coffee tasted a bit too sour for us. Why!?! We asked for more cream and sweetener which made it a little better. The avocado toast was ok, but again tasted a bit too tart for our liking. It was more like eating guacamole on a flax seedy toast. All in all, I'm glad we tried it but wouldn't go again. Sorry Blue Bottle, we really wanted to like you!
author: Annie G.

description: The service was amazing ! Best place to have a light and amazing tasteful breakfast ! If You are coming to SF you must stop by . This place is awesome .
author: Sahar E.

description:
Blue Bottle was great! The customer service was quick and efficient, despite how crowded the store was. I ordered a Latte (this is where I need to insert a disclaimer and admit that I am by no means a regular coffee drinker) and to my inexperienced taste buds, I found it delicious. 

I would definitely come back to try their avocado toast when I get the chance! The pictures on yelp make it seem fantastic.
author: Allison T.

description: The place where the third wave began. As a former barista, this place is a Mecca of sorts. I was thrilled with the Nel brew method that a barista labored over for me for nearly 10 minutes, walking curious me through each step of the process. And that canned cold brew was great to have on hand throughout my stay in SF. Can't wait to come back when I'm here next.
author: Zach C.

description:
Drinking a brew from Blue Bottle Coffee is like someone seeing his or her online date for the first time in real life who actually looks like the uploaded (filtered) profile pic. No, this is not from experience. No, really. I'm being honest.

Basically, I'm saying Blue Bottle is bae.

To pop my Blue Bottle cherry, I visited with a few amigos before the rush hour (late 7AMish), and we luckily avoided a painstakingly long line that later formed out the door. When my turn came to order, I coffee slutted it up and asked for both the cappuccino and cold brew (Three Africas Beans).
*****
I. COFFEE
The baristas crafted me a solid *cappuccino with perfect parts milk and coffee. The beans produced a really bold, subtly earthy and chocolaty taste. I want to drink this everyday of my life. How can we make this happen?

But, while cappuccinos are fantastic, I do love me some *cold brew. And I most certainly indulged in a caffeinated concoction that SERIOUSLY HAD STRONG NOTES OF BLUEBERRIES. I couldn't believe what I tasted, and I didn't care for the high-for-cold-brew acidity level. Blueberries? Come on. What village did Blue Bottle have to burn down to get this sourced coffee to taste like this. This was the best cold brew of my life, yo. 

II. SERVICE
Regarding their service, the baristas worked as diligently as they could without comprising the quality of their work. Also, I didn't see any eye-rolling when I asked questions. No problems there.

III. AMBIENCE & DECOR
It's a step above minimalist aka clean, bright, and airy. I would like to decorate my home like this, if I were a baller. 

IV. PRICES
Pay the premiums! They care for their beans, and they should satisfy any serious coffee lover's cravings.

V. OVERALL
The next time I return to San Francisco, I'm definitely making another trip there. Blue Bottle is the real deal, and I'm having a hard time trying to find a reason to look elsewhere. Fuggit. I ain't. 'Cause Blue Bottle is bae.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Whose idea was clear glass coffee "mugs?"

Make sure you use the handle and your fingers aren't so big they touch the glass, you might get burned. 

Almond butter toast cut at an angle, which is fine, but not separated so made a complete mess when trying to pick up what I thought was a large single piece of toast. In fairness, I brought this to the guy's attention and he said he would separate them. We'll see. 

Coffee is fine.
author: Peter S.

description: Love this place! First time here and I couldn't be more pleased. I got the New Orleans with almond milk (whole milk tastes better with it if you are okay that). Everyone here is so nice & precise. I asked what the New Orleans tasted like & they offered me a sample. Why doesn't  every coffee place do that?! When I requested almond milk the barista taste tested the milk to make sure it was almond milk! Much appreciated!!! Wish I had this back home because I would come here all the time.
author: Alexis P.

description: There was a long line to get coffee here. I ordered the New Orleans Iced Coffee and the Butter Brown Sugar Apple Buckle pastry. The pastry was really good, moist and not overly sweet. The New Orleans iced coffee was good too, just the right amount of sugar where you can still taste the coffee. Would return.
author: Cui Cui Z.

description: Some of the best coffee I have tried. The folks who make it are super nice and as I said the coffee is smooth and delicious.
author: Cedric W.

description: I like this Blue Bottle for its efficiency and choice location. Just a short stroll from the Powell Station and located in a quaint area away from the bustling streets. It can be pretty packed in the morning but the line will move quick with the quick . It's worth it for that smooth New Orleans ice coffee and piping hot latte.
author: Gary Y.

description:
I had kenya and my friend had new Orleans. 

The cup design is pretty nice. I loved drip coffee
author: Chul W.

description: I love Blue Bottle and visit it whenever I can in LA. Had to make a stop in SF. We loved our coffees and this spot is so hip and quaint I would recommend it no matter the time of day.
author: Laura M.

description:
So busy they have a coffee cart outside to try to handle demand. And said cart handles your coffee basics -- pour over, cold brew, etc. I took a gander at the line that was wrapping around the brick-and-mortar and opted for the cart. Blue Bottle takes their coffee pretty effing seriously, as one pour over took about five minutes to make.

Yeah, I waited a bit but it was worth it. I'll clear a couple hours off my calendar the next time I want to grab a seat inside and enjoy another magical coffee drink and a bite. Also: Don't forget to grab a bag of beans to go.

Warning: Human feces likely to be found on the sidewalks souring the alley this BBCC calls home.
author: Will S.

description: Hip & cheap! Barista are awesome. Been visiting to San Fran and glad I found the shop.
author: Tylar B.

description:
Worth the wait! Amazing coffee! Food is limited and didn't get a chance to try so can't comment.

But coffee is really yummy
author: Masa C.

description:
We were in San Francisco visiting for 4 days, and started our mornings off here every single day. 

They have a great selection of slow drip single origin coffees to choose from, and the few we had were all excellent! We noticed there was almost always a line; during the week 8-10 people, and on the weekends closer to 20. However they kept the lines moving at a pretty good pace. TIP: If you're going to just get a slow drip (rather than a latte/macchiato or food) they have a little tent set up just outside in the plaza where there is almost never a line or a wait.

2 of the mornings we also had some breakfast, overnight oatmeal one day and their breakfast sandwich the next, both of which were portioned perfectly and delicious at that. 

Everything they seemed to do/make seemed to be of high quality and fresh ingredients.
author: Michael H.

description:
Craft coffee at its finest. Blue Bottle's product goes unmatched. The beans, siphons, espresso, breakfast, etc. It's truly remarkable how fine-tuned this oiled machine operates during their day to day operations.

Why not 5 stars? The wait times are ridiculous. Even with a dozen employees behind the counter - cashiers, baristas, line cooks - prepare for a 30 minute lapse, at least. If ordering breakfast, make sure you have no pressing plans.

I came here three times during my stay in SF, and each one was pleasant. The cappuccinos are world-class. The consistency and roasted flavor were stellar upon each sip. Also, the breakfast sandwich was very good. The soft, brioche bun took my breath away.

Buy some beans for the road. The house espresso, 17 Foot Ceiling, calls for multiple takes. Get your brew on, fools!
author: Matthew C.

description:
Delicious coffee and love that they use organic milk or milk alternatives.
I would say the sizes are a tad small for the price tag but then again it is San Fran.
Nice laid back atmosphere and music and very friendly barista :)
author: Lauren H.

description:
There were only a few people in line around 8:30 on a Sunday morning. I'm guessing this place would be packed on weekdays based on location.

The Breakfast Sandwich ($12, frittata, bacon, arugula on brioche) and toast with jam ($4ish) were tasty... but not the best. I'd skip the simple toast next time. The Avocado Toast looked amazing, though.

The New Orleans cold brew ($4) & Cappuccino ($4), on the other hand, were the best coffees I've had in San Francisco! Yum.
author: Shannon C.

description:
We stopped by Blue Bottle for a quick breakfast one day while we were visiting San Francisco and we loved it. 

Friendly staff, clean establishment, great food and awesome coffee. 

Their was a small line when we went, but it moved fast. 

If you are staying near Union Square and are looking for great coffee or for a quick breakfast, this is definitely the place to go.
author: Frank S.

description: They had the cutest and simplistic interior design, you felt so refreshed and relaxed when you step in there. The staff were really upbeat, full of energy and really cater to what you want and will tell you what each coffee will taste like and how it's made (they know their stuff). It was a little hard to find seating as it was so popular. In Australian, our coffee order is always served to us at the table by a waitstaff, but at Blue Bottle, I had to wait for my number to be called and carry my cup of coffee to my table (I'm not sure if this is an American thing to serve yourself), but I am naturally clumpsy and spilt my coffee
author: Shan N.

description:
That mocha though.

It's one the chocolatiest, richest, most satisfying beverages you'll find in SF.

If the mocha isn't enough to draw you to Blue Bottle Coffee, there's also the ambiance.  It's a beautiful space, tucked away in an alley that most passers-by would miss if it weren't for the scent of freshly brewed coffee wafting down the block.

There's also a line -- one that wraps around the block during peak hours.  It moves quickly, so have patience.  But don't bother trying to find a place to sit, since Macbook-toting squatters pretty much own the place.

Thankfully, the mocha tastes just as excellent if you get it to go.
author: David G.

description: We went there around 7am. There was few people so didn't wait for seats. We ordered sunny side up, toast , hot latte and cappuccino. Their grain toasts were too hard to eat. It's really small portion and pricey. Nothing special and surprising us even coffee.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
Here's the thing - the coffee is exceptional.  The problem is that lines are extremely long, it will be a challenge to find a seat, and it sometimes feels like you are inconveniencing the staff by ordering something.

There is no wifi, prices are high, but food and drink are great so I still find myself going there when I am in the area if the line isn't wrapped around the building.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Good brunch and crowded which is always a good sign.
Don't serve fruits neither orange's juice which hopefully will change and complete the menu
author: Bruno C.

description: I was so excited to try blue bottle because it's hipster and hyped up. I think it's overhyped though. I got the New Orleans which was an iced coffee, and it wasn't very strong at all. It kind of tasted like a latte but even less strong than one. It was good but if you wanted a stronger coffee, that wasn't it. It tasted kind of like milk. My mom got the Oakland lights because she wanted to try a stronger coffee and it had a really weird taste to it. We asked the cashier if the coffee was acidic and she said no, but it had a strong weird acidic taste. I wouldn't get that again. If I were to come back I would get something stronger but not the Oakland lights. Maybe just a regular coffee or a latte. The staff here are very kind and want the best for the customer, which is always a plus and makes the experience way better.
author: Lauren L.

description: I came to blue bottle to try there New Orleans coffee and it was not as great as I read but I do try there cafe latte and that was sweet and had a good flavor! The only complaint I have is that they stop serving food at 230 so make sure you go before then!
author: Michelle M.

description: Cafe mocha here is amazing! It has chocolate ganache in it and is very smooth. They definitely do things different here than most coffee shops.
author: Moiz T.

description:
I'm town on business and my boss found this place, looking for something different from Starbucks. This is apparently a chain here, yet this location is a neat little space tucked away off of Market Street, around the corner from the Moscone Center.

Their coffee is fabulous! I've had the New Orleans cold brew twice now, which is made with hickory, milk and cane sugar, and it is fabulous! Very tasty...and much better than my beloved Starbucks! I wish we had Blue Bottles in Chicago!

I also had their breakfast sandwich, which was good as well. It was a mufalatta of some sort on a brioche roll with bacon and arugula. Yum! 

There is limited seating and it can get crowded, yet I really like this place!
author: Joani O.

description:
This was our first visit to a Blue Bottle coffee house.  It had a short line and people were able to order quickly. It looked like most people had been here before and ordered an amazing variety of the specialty beverages offered here.  

The brewing process is pretty unique so check it out while waiting for your drinks.  They have a pretty good website that explains and demonstrates the brewing process.

I have to say the coffee was very good!
author: Russ V.

description: Dayum came for the weekend from Seattle and found the best affogato I've eva had. This place was busy as hell on a Sunday afternoon but it was worth the wait. Avocado toast was  fire. The fellow who looks like Russ the rapper was making our drinks. Our Affogato ticket was lost and he noticed I kept looking towards him to see if it was my turn, so he asked if we were waiting and said he never got the ticket for the drink. He apologized and made us 2! What a bawse. Please give that man a raise. Def comin back next time in town!
author: Omari W.

description:
No need to say "third times' a charm" because the second time coming here was enough to charm me.

Since the last time I've been here, my coffee taste buds have changed. Long gone are the sweet coffee drinks. I never cared too much for Frappuccinos anyways but I've always enjoyed an iced caramel macchiato. Nowadays, that's considered too sweet for me.

This time, I ordered their caffe latte. It was strong and creamy. Definitely gave me a pep for the morning. Boyfriend and I shared the breakfast sandwich and it tasted really good. I would get that again.

We waited in line for about 15 minutes on a Sunday morning. No surprise there since it was Memorial Day weekend. Busy busy. Wish it wasn't so cold that day, I wanted to give their New Orleans iced coffee another try. I know I will like it better than the first time around.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I subscribe to their coffee subscription, so this had to be a stop on a recent trip to San Fran. This place is epic and a coffee lovers jam. Great coffee, nothing fancy and I loved that. They do serve food, which I did not get. But the breakfast looked legit. Hoping to make a return trip one day, and will be sure to hit this up again. 

Must stop for any coffee lover.
author: Eric G.

description: I'll start with saying I love blue bottle coffee. My bacon and pecan scone was so delicious. But when they "made" my iced coffee, I watched the guy open the same iced coffee you buy at any grocery store. The little blue box that's like $3 at Safeway, literally just popped one open and pours it in a cup for $4.75 I believe it was. Wtf.
author: Pharoah J.

description: Such a beautiful yet simple place. It's in a secluded corner behind the hub of Union Square. I always get their cafe latte and although I'm mostly a tea drinker, I always make an exception for Blue Bottle because their lattes are insanely incredible. I came 15 minutes til 10 am, and although there was already a line, the line got bigger as it approached 10. The service was kind and friendly, not pretentious whatsoever. I brought my parents who are quite loyal to Peet's, but they prefer to go to Blue Bottle when in the city. Definitely a special place to take a coffee lover.
author: Fern S.

description: I don't know how many cups of coffee I had throughout this SF trip. Probably all my energy was run by caffeine. Anyways...I stopped by Blue Bottle Coffee only because my mom wanted to try the latte. The cashier was friendly and there was no line, so getting my coffee was an easy in-n-out the door. I opted for a cold brew to wake me up for the drive. Boy, the coffee was strong, but not in a bitter nasty way. It did its job and kept me wide awake for the drive to Monterey Bay. I will have to try out their other items next time. (New Orlean? most popular)
author: Sarah C.

description:
WOO! Blue Bottle has been on my list for awhile. They did not disappoint. I was happily surprised by the amount of blends they had available. Not as much options as Philz, but all the choices sounded unique and top shelf. I had a cup of the Giant Steps.That's a good cup of coffee. Bold, heavy, full, sits on the tongue real well--nice balance of acid and flavor.

They have many blends they sell if you like to make coffee at home and even blends pre-ground for certain coffee making processes. The location is tucked away and if you enter from the back entrance, you'll pass the restrooms before you can get into the shop--but you're on your way to some good coffee !
author: Edrian B.

description: I must preface by saying that I only got coffee grounds from them, I did not have them make me any coffee. I have to say, I made the Bella Donovan coffee at home and it has got to be the best coffee I have ever had. I wish we had a blue bottle coffee in Orange County but we are plagued with Starbucks which I can't stand. I guess for now, I will have to try and purchase this coffee online or drive to L.A to get it. Highly recommended!
author: Carol D.

description: This coffee is still perfect.  cool vibe , and everyone is super chill. I love the pour overs although they have several types of brewing magic going on.
author: Manny G.

description: I love my blue bottle, but this one is tiny, overcrowded, and super slow!  Waited for over 15 min for a latte on a Wednesday morning. I guess it is all the tech companies nearby + tourists from the market st area. Also, agree with the other reviews that say customer service is no great. The baristas don't seem to care that you have been waiting, and two of them were just hanging out by an unused espresso machine. Maybe they could have fired that thing up??  Had I known, I would have grabbed something else nearby. BB is good, but not worth 20 min of my life.
author: Cyndy C.

description: I found the Blue Bottle Coffee next to the Hampton Inn that we were staying at. This place turned out to be a diamond in the rough. I got a cafe mocha and it was really great. It's creamy and it was not to sweet. They really know coffee.
author: Mark H.

description:
The usual line was there but despite that we got excellent service. We knew what we wanted when we ordered but my other half had some Qs. (He's fully lactose intolerant.) The cashier was so pleasant and kind, when she didn't know the answer she even asked someone in the kitchen. She was awesome!

The wait was worth it. My flat white was fantastic! Other half? Not convinced he got soy. (He had some deleterious side-effects later.) But, it tasted great at the time! :D 

I loved my perfectly poached eggs. The avocado toast had some pickled radishes on it I wasn't crazy about... But hey! Taste is subjective and I just picked 'em off... Happy camper! 

Yay!
author: Lea S.

description: The coffee is ok. Maybe a little over hyped. The barista don't smile or ask us how we were doing, just to the point doing their business. Not rude, just not great service. The latte and the mocha was just alright, nothing too great. Maybe it's just a nor cal thing :/
author: Megha U.

description:
Their logo on the exterior wall is huge lol. After you walk in, the place itself is actually not that big. They have some seats outside as well. I ordered their new Orleans iced coffee, which tasted really good. I am by no means an expert in coffee tasting, but I am happy with what I got. 

The store itself looks very clean. When I go to restaurants, I always concern about how they prepare my food, is everything sanitized enough etc. It is not an issue here. Good job.
author: Lucas B.

description: This a pretty cool coffee place! They have a friendly staff and delicious coffee! My personal favorite at this location is their iced cold brew or their affogato. The location is a bit small but it's a nice cozy place to enjoy a cup of coffee.
author: Kunzu K.

description:
They make a rad New Orleans, the layout is cute even though every seat will be taken and you'll likely have to (briefly) wait outside the building to place your order, and I'm glad Blue Bottle exists here. 

The people who work here are so friendly and they really staff the place up so even when it's busy your stuff will never take that long. 

The restrooms are located through the corridor/hallway and you need a key to use them or wait outside to see if one opens, but be warned, peeps just loooove to camp out in there (looking at you, MEN).
