One thing I wish were different is the surplus of buggies flying around the cookie and pastry case. One gnat... ok, it happens. Two... alright, they're probably friends. Three... awww, mom, dad, and baby. Four... alright enough is enough. We've got a one child policy on these pastries and you better gtf off my god damned cookie.
author: Candice G.

description: Crowded coffee shop recommended by a friend who used to live in SF. Loved the option to try siphon coffee, though I think a chemex extracts similar notes from the beans at a lower cost and in less time. The food options are enjoyable but are a bit on the pricier side. The variety of beans as well as brewing styles is great. Staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Emily A.

description: My favorite coffee shop in SF. The Bella Donovan blend was so smooth and delicious!
author: P. J.

description: This is little hole in the wall coffee shop but had great coffee and breakfast . I had the avocado toast which was delicious with a mocha and my daughter had a pressed ham and cheese sandwich that she devoured lol my husband had espresso and ordered poached eggs but they failed to tell him they didn't have anymore so instead we waited 30 minutes for them to then come ask if he was waiting for food and he told them he was waiting for the poached eggs , then they told him they didn't have any and if he would like something else . After 30 minutes of waiting . Ridiculous; he ordered sunny side eggs instead .
author: Jesika A.

description: First time.  Latte is glorious, delicious, smooth, creamy, yummy, delightful, perfect, wonderful, and noteworthy.
author: Loren B.

description: Good coffee but scary walk! Bought a lb to take back home. Recommended by a friend who loves coffee.
author: Amy A.

description: Very cool that I was able to visit the first Blue Bottle location!  Love the sign on the front, Love the coffee and the passion that goes into what Blue Bottle does!  Will definitely be back!
author: Greg K.

description:
How does this place not have a solid five stars? The coffee is delicious and the food is to die for. I came here twice during my four days in San Francisco.

My first visit was around 8 am on a weekday and I ordered a latte and avocado toast. The avocado toast comes seasoned with sesame seeds, a few spices, and PICKLED RADISH. The bread was also super tasty making the whole dining experience pretty magical. My latte was also perfect. The meal came out to $15. You order at the counter and then take your number for food to a spot in the room but you pick up your own coffee at the counter. On a weekday, it was busy but manageable. 

My second visit was on a Saturday morning at around 8:30 am and the place was packed to the brim, there was a line outside! I ordered a latte, avocado toast because it was so good the first time, and overnight chilled oats because I wanted to be really full. This meal came out to $21. 

The coffee and toast was perfect like last time. The chilled oats really blew me away. It was super hearty and came with candied FRUITS which made it incredibly tasty.

If I have to come back to SF, I plan to dine here everyday.
author: Eileen C.

description:
I'm by no means a coffee connoisseur, but I do enjoy trying all the various local coffee shops in SF, even if all I order is a latte :)

Blue Bottle coffee is on the stronger side, and one of the menu highlights is the coffee ice cream sundae (don't remember the exact name). Avoid the green tea, it almost looks too green and is nothing special.

This location is conveniently located, and had a fair mix of people working, reading, and people on a work break catching up. Also a decent number of tourists here.
author: Tim X.

description: Good coffee, friendly staff, and nice latte art. Big crew keeps even the big lines moving quickly. Pastry selection looks rather dry though.
author: Darren H.

description:
This is the 2nd Blue Bottle Coffee establishment that I have been to and this one was even better than the last. It's located in the back corner of a building but you'll know you're at the right place when you see the long line of people out the door trying to get their caffeine fix.

I ordered the Caffe Latte and my cousins ordered the Hot Cocoa. The latte was just as good as I had hoped. Rich coffee flavor with a smooth creamy finish from the milk. Plus the art is spectacular! These baristas are pros! Somehow they are able to create art in every single cup. The hot cocoa was amazing as well! Kids may not like it because it has a dark chocolate taste to it, but I loved it! And it doesn't have that chalky feeling at the end that you normally get at Starbucks. 

Overall, the place is nice, with more seating than the Oakland location. The location is away from the main street so you have to be in the know to find out. The coffee here is top notch plus they serve food like waffles and such. Highly recommend!
author: Ryan J.

description: The staff here was extremely kind and helpful! (Not at all what i'd expect from such a busy place) The store is a little small, but I was able to find a spot comfortably and stick around without pressure from others about finding a seat. Although it is a bit pricier than other coffee stores, they are serving genuine coffee, so you are paying for the quality. I will definitely stop by whenever I am nearby!!
author: Shreya P.

description: breakfast was so simple but good! i meant to order Avocado toast with poached eggs but i forgot to say "avocado" ( don't ask how) so when the food came out i told the waitress and she kindly return with some avocado on the side for me. the poached eggs were perfect with a dash with salt and pepper. ham egg and cheese sandwich were really good as well. every latte/coffee cup is crafted to perfection!
author: Vicky H.

description: If I'm paying eight dollars for a large cup of coffee I'd expected it to be life alteringly good and be the size of an ice bucket. This was mediocre at best and was in a shot glass. I'd recommend going elsewhere.
author: Derek A.

description: setup was nice. the staff behind the counter all did their best to keep the crowd moving. I was satisfied with my latte, while it was a bit overpriced. for the chain it has become, I was happy with the quality. the staff taking my order was very kind as well, so that goes a long way in my book.
author: Mal C.

description: This is the best coffee I've ever had. I'm new to the tasting and have only had cheaper coffees but this has changed my mind on how good coffee can be . Great experience ! It is also nice that the service is all friendly and inviting . The setting is great too, music isn't to loud and It is a place you can socialize and enjoy a great drink.
author: Sam B.

description: I love love love coffee and I've heard of Blue Bottle, but actually haven't tried it till today when I was hanging out with friends in the city. There was a line out the door when we got there, but ordering and the service was quick and efficient. I got the New Orleans, which my friend recommended, and it was delicious. It's an iced coffee with milk and it had a good balance of coffee flavors, sweetness of the sugar, and milkiness. Would definitely come back if I'm in the area!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Our regular stop. Time it right and the wait is not horrible. The staff is very efficient and you can't go wrong with ANY menu item. 
The quality is high and even the New Orleans coffee was great after a few days of macchiattos. 
Give it time. It's worth it.
author: David B.

description: It is a blue bottle so the coffee is unreal and the staff are excellent, but it is a little dingy around the cafe and the area... and its not the nicest of the blue bottle shops around the bay area... but that coffee its so so good! but if you want to sit and enjoy the view and people watch this is not the blue bottle for you!
author: Reg B.

description: Solidly the same oat milk latte at every blue bottle. Their science works. This location gets so so packed so be prepared to wait about 20 minutes.
author: A L.

description: Great coffee! Can't remember what I ordered, but it was what the cashier recommended, and it did not disappoint! Didn't order any food but what was coming out of the kitchen looked good. If you're looking for the best coffee in San Francisco, look no further.
author: Nick C.

description: Good coffee, decent prices, nice and helpful waitstaff and servers. Clean environment and lots of seating. Would recommend.
author: Zoe M.

description: Cute little hippie cafe.  The avocado toast with poached eggs were yummy!!  Not much seating but the wait wasn't bad (10 min).
author: tammy l.

description: Wonderful coffee! Surprisingly fast for a pour over joint. Nice ambiance and design too.
author: Nick W.

description: The coffee's good and smooth. The cafe's are cute. I like their breakfast sandwiches too.
author: Nadira A.

description: Blue bottle has got a world class infrastructure which i like the most .But sitting arrangement are hasty hastle.customer service is perfect.The smoothness and taste of coffee was soo adorable that i can't think better coffee than that.They have limited flavours but the one which they have are superb.
author: Eva G.

description: I had a cappuccino. It was very smooth. Nice vibe busy place.  Only complaint would be cappuccino  could be bigger. It's smaller than most other coffee shops.
author: M P.

description:
The people that complain that the line doesn't move quickly must not have experience with gourmet coffee aka not Starbucks. The line to pay is out the door; however, it moves quickly. The wait for your drink is appropriate based on the level of skill it takes to handcraft your exceptional coffee. Quit crying!

Giant steps: Delicious. Viscous. Fudgy. 
Caffe Mocha: also chocolatey, delicious, and quite smooth. 

It is definitely busy inside! They have indoor and outdoor seating for you to sit down, enjoy your drinks, and eat some breakfast. The parking is metered so be prepared to spend $3.75 an hour for parking. Most people pay the meter just to get their coffee and leave, so if you're just wanting to grab-and-go as well, check if someone has left time on the meter before you fill it.
author: Bianca C.

description: I live in LA, that is where I tried Blue Bottle Coffee. I can honestly say their consistently is incredible, they create the same experience in every location. I highly recommend this coffee shop. Amazing coffee, friendly staff.
author: Alex C.

description:
I love this coffee shop. It's trendy, cool looking with tall ceilings and away from the street in a quiet corner. If you did not know this place existed you probably would not find it. There is no sign outside the shop and all you see the number 66 Mint outside the shop and a small Blue Bottle logo. 

It looks like a chemistry lab on the inside with narrow long tables and some space to sit along the big old windows and look out. It's certainly not the place to sit out and people watch as there is barely anyone on this street besides people who are coming to this shop. The inside however is a whole different story....trendy people ordering coffee and eating breakfast ;-))

I love their coffee and whilst I am not a big fan of cold brew and so on, I always appreciate a good cuppa coffee :-) they also have a limited choice of food items and you can buy beans to take home. They use cloverleaf organic milk and the coffee has been consistently good here.
author: Sam S.

description:
I must preface with this: I'm not a coffee drinker. Not sometimes. Not even a little bit. I will say though, this was a pretty cool spot!

I'd heard of Blue Bottle before but had never been to one of their locations. When visiting SF last weekend we wanted to cool spot for breakfast and I'm glad we came here!

The menu is small, but we had the toast w/ eggs and the waffle w/ bacon. They could use a bit of seasoning, but for the most part were pretty good. Very hip vibe to the place, and they do some really cool stuff with their coffee. Seemed like a mix of a coffee bar and a science lab. 

Nice to know you can enjoy a place like this even if you're the only person there who didn't order a coffee!
author: Josh F.

description:
A great spot to get both coffee and eats.

I postponed eating brunch their for a while because I was skeptical about how good it could be...but ermagersh it was good (especially for the price)
- Avocado toast w/a side of poached eggs.  I guess the city is filled with avocado toasts, but still...this one was pretty good.  The accompanying aioli and pickled something-or-other accompanied the creamy avocado well.
- Waffle w/syrup and butter.  Simple, good outer crisp...which in my opinion is the major determining factor of a good waffle.  They pour a good amount of syrup on it before serving, so it was on the sweeter side; if you're not into sweet, ask for syrup on the side.  Probably not anything to fawn over if you're not a waffle fan, but if you are, it gets the job done real good.
- Moroccan Baked Eggs.  GET THIS!!  2 poached eggs swimming in a pool of red sauce deliciousness.  The spices, the chunks of tomato, the side of acme bread for dipping....I'm drooling as I relive this.

Venue
High ceilings and lots of natural light (perfect for you food instagramers out there).  The only downside is that seating is limited in the fairly small space, so get ready to share some personal space.  Definitely not a place to camp out and study.  Get your goods, chill and eat for a bit, then clear house so someone else can sit down...thanks ;)
author: Mon T.

description: Great find! Love the location, super friendly staff and good coffee. Had the New Orleans, which i highly suggest if your a fan of cold brew.
author: Matthew P.

description: Had breakfast one time which was simple and good. The coffee was fresh and the experience was wonderful. They have outdoor seating as well
author: Christopher R.

description: The Best coffee on the west coast! I've been a barista for 8 years and nothing compares to this place! The latte art and macchiatos are made to perfection, you won't be disappointed!
author: Bella B.

description: My best reason to return to San Francisco. New Orleans coffee and muffin will make you day.
author: Chun J.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco! The staff are friendly, the atmosphere is that if a hip coffee shop. Worth the walk!
author: Lisa R.

description:
Blue bottle chain always find hidden gems and alleyways to locate their coffee beans at.  This place is one of those spots.

I was meeting up with an out of city, dear friend of mine and opted for Blue bottle since it is a staple for San Francisco.

This coffee stop was it.  It's tucked away in an alley that is not too far from central Westfield mall and offers seclusion if you want to get away from the bustling crowd. 

Quaint surrounding and an open plaza was of existence here.  Like Blue bottle coffee's aroma, the ambiance provided an urban feel to just shy yourself into.  

Kickback and remember to smell the coffee.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This place is perfect to do a bit of reading or get some work done. Also great if you've got a friend to accompany you and you just want to talk. I went in on a sunny afternoon after lunch and ordered a Macchiato and spent hours reading and people watching -- one of my favourite urban activities. 

I'm yet to try out their New Orleans Iced Coffee but I'm fairly sure that's what I'll have when I'm visiting next.
author: Gouthaman K.

description: Mmmmmm. Yummy latte!  I only wish it were bottomless!  I would have left it at yummy latte that but yelp is telling me to write more. Some of us are people of few words.  So, what I meant to say was mmmmmm. Yummy latte.
author: P. K.

description: Me and my wife stumbled across this gem, the coffee here is great and the staff are very friendly. I can safely say if we are back in the area we will stop back in for another  round of joe.
author: Reggie B.

description: Poor customer service. I went there this morning, I was the third one in the door at 6:30 AM, spent $60 on coffee, food and swag. But then I had to wait a full 18 minutes for a drip coffee with a shot of espresso despite the fact that there were four employees working. And the clincher is, when the copy finally arrived, it wasn't very hot and it tasted bitter.
author: Joe L.

description: Certainly, the best coffee and the best place for coffee. Coffee is always fresh. The process of preparing coffee based on espresso is fascinating. Definitely recommend. I can safely say that this is my favorite place.
author: Elliana H.

description: Cute small coffee shop on the corner of a back alley in downtown San Francisco. The service and quality of coffee were both amazing! I had the 3 africas coffee and it was some pretty darn good coffee! I'll definitely be back here on my next coffee run.
author: Suzan H.

description:
Such a cute little shop! It reminds me of everything I love about cafes. It smelled amazing in there, inviting music and nice staff. There was a line out the door when I was there.
I got the New Orleans coffee which was delicious! It's very flavorful and unique! It was about $4 which is pricey but whatevs. 
They also have a little booth outside for additional service if the lines get too long and you want something simple. 
I didn't get any pastries but they looked great!
author: Ami T.

description:
An early morning pilgrimage for what we were told was one of the best cups of coffee in SF was a mission and a half to say the least. Walking along the poop covered streets (human poo) made said journey all the more magical. 

Just about the time I was ready to turn back after my third morning gag we turned a corner, down a side street and came upon a lengthy line in front of a nondescript building with only... A blue bottle on the outside. We'd arrived. 

The line up was long, not because there were a lot of people waiting, but because they take so much time, care, attention..... TIME, to make their coffee. Seriously, I don't know how y'all in SF do coffee but I'm about to slap someone when my morning java takes that long. There was even one coffee that they weren't event going to begin making until 9 am!!

 I went with a latté and just about the time when I was going to tweak out my name was called and I was presented with the most perfectly crafted latté I'd ever seen. The balance of the espresso and the perfect froth and temperature of the milk made this latté a breeze to drink. In fact, it didn't even need anything extra added to it (except for a cup sleeve and a lid).

Great cup of coffee, definitely something I'd rather take time enjoy instead of be made to wait for until I wanted to die. Not worth the walk into the tenderloin but worth a visit if they had more convenient locations!
author: Kris U.

description:
Location: This is such a cute place with great lighting! Very convenient for shoppers as it's located close to the Westfield Shopping Center. However, place is pretty small so probably best to do a grab-and-go from here when it gets busy.

My go-to is always a New Orleans (if you're up for an iced drink) but also love their Latté. Something about the balance between the sweetness and strong caffeine taste makes me order the New Orleans over and over again (even during the winter in SF).
author: Vivian W.

description:
I love this coffee, I've tried it in Tokyo and was looking forward to my trip to San Francisco. It's a small little corner shop with a line out the block and it's well deserved. Definitely get the New Orleans iced coffee; they serve it fresh but you can also get it to go in a cool little milk carton. 

Definitely not a place to hang out and do work because it gets loud and busy, but the quality of coffee cannot be denied. 5 stars, can't wait to go back and try it again.
author: Kenneth T.

description: No WiFi, extremely crowded, and extremely overpriced (avocado toast is $9) but the coffee was good and staff was pleasant. Would not recommend as a sit-down place. Just grab a coffee and go!
author: Harlan P.

description: Loved the hidden nature of this coffee shop; made me feel like a sleuth trying to find it. Had the avocado toast, which was recommended from the most gorgeous valet at the Intercontinental, and was not disappointed. I drank The Ogi iced coffee and my friend had a cappuccino. Both were super delicious and I cannot wait until the next time so I can order the same thing!
author: Kathyrn L.

description: Pricey/trendy coffee/tea place in a good location. Kinda noisy so not great for work/meetings except for the 4-5 tables outside when there is good weather.  Drinks start at $4 + tax & tip.
author: Leung T.

description:
Ended up here on a coffee adventure around the city with some fellow work peeps since a lot of us had some time to kill before having to head back to the airport to go home. It's sort of off the beaten path in a corner of an alley with other businesses and food trucks - so if you get distracted, you might pass it by. The confusing part was that they have a satellite station with a pop-up tent to help alleviate all the traffic going into the retail space - they serve the same stuff inside, but they don't have any iced drinks and it's a much more abbreviated menu.

The girl working the booth noticed stunned expressions when everything that was being offered on the Yelp app was nowhere to be found, and told us that we probably wanted to turn around and head to the REAL shop. She was right!

I loved the indoor/outdoor coffee shop. Since it was a nice day, you could sit inside while looking out without having the windows in your way. You got some fresh air without having to be hit with the sun. The aroma of the cafe was quite strong as it's not a huge place, but when a lot of people are inside, it gets quite warm with body heat real fast. I'm sure the dual reasoning for no windows was to allow for a cross breeze to come in through the cafe to make sure it didn't become an oven.

They have the standard lattes, mochas, coffees and such, but they have some cool cold brew selections as well as concoctions that look like they're being crafted in a science laboratory. The more complex and crazy you get - the more expense your cup of Joe becomes. As a creature of habit, I went with an Iced Americano and it did not disappoint. They pull their own shots here so my drink was nice and strong.

The pastries and desserts looked fantastic, but since I had just had breakfast, I was not in the mood. If you love their coffee, they sell it by the package in both whole beans and ground, which is a nice touch if you're just visiting and want to experience they great options in the comfort of whatever city you are in.

Service was friendly and I really enjoyed my drink. I'd definitely come back the next time I'm in SF... hopefully with more room in my stomach for a sweet treat to pair with it!
author: Ryan C.

description: Great coffee and super friendly staff.  The day I went it was really, really packed.  So packed that a women picked up my order and left before I realized what was happening!  Fortunately, the staff whipped up mine very quickly after realizing the mistake and gave me a coupon for a free drink next time.
author: Mark H.

description:
A coffee experience for the ages. 

From the moment you walk into Blue Bottle you're enveloped by the beautiful aroma of coffee, and awestruck at the beauty and grace this coffee shop has. I got some single origin espresso and it was extraordinarily delicious. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants to experience an unorthodox, but extraordinary coffee experience.
author: Mason S.

description:
We came early on Sat morning and the line wasn't too bad. There was seating in the communal table so that worked out well.

The line moved quickly and we received our drinks pretty quickly. It took a bit longer to get our food, but it was worth the wait.

I had the avocado toast with latte. The avocado toast was very filling even though it was only one piece. The bread was toasted, but a little too hard for my taste. Otherwise, how can anyone mess up avocado toast?!

My latte was creamy and good even though I couldn't finish it. There's a big jug of water by the entrance for those of you who need water after coffee!

The atmosphere is great too - high ceilings, open space, wooden tables by large windows, and outdoor seating.
author: Lillian C.

description:
Oji (wan) I will follow you to the end of the Earth and back just to learn your delicious ways! 

In case you're not familiar, which I certainly wasn't before visiting Blue Bottle, Oji is a Japanese method of preparing cold brewed coffee that produces a more viscous final product with a complex flavor offering notes of bourbon and chocolate balanced out with just the right amount of acidity and brightness. At the back of this Blue Bottle location you can see the Oji apparatus used to brew this beautiful beverage. It was truly a work of art and something to behold. I wish I had asked how it worked, but I was mesmerized by the black gold slowly dropping and collecting at the bottom and forget to ask.

I'm all about new experiences and I never really thought a coffee shop would deliver one. But Blue Bottle proved it ain't your typical coffee shop from the minute we walked in. I enjoyed my Oji to the last drop, and wish there was a place to get some in Reno. Until then, I'm looking forward to trying the espresso roast I picked up!
author: Michael T.

description: Really like the location in the Mint Plaza.  We were there late Sat afternoon and there were homeless people lying around.  About 5pm, a couple of security staff started to clear out the loiterers in time for the restaurants in the plaza to open up.  Coffee wise, very good!  I had an americano and hubby had a cappuccino.
author: Helen T.

description:
Longest lines everrrrr! I waited a good 30 minutes in the cold just for a latte. 

The area this coffee shop is in looks a bit sketchy but the coffee itself is definitely worth getting at least once. I usually get the iced new orleans coffee (one of their most popular drinks). However, it was really cold this weekend in SF & I was pretty desperate for some kind of caffeine fix (I was up since 5am T-T), so I grabbed a latte. 

It warmed me right up & gave me enough caffeine to last through the day. They also sell some baked goods near the cash register & the snickerdoodle cookies looked so yummy. That's definitely something I need to try next time.
author: Josephine Y.

description: The wait is atrocious, but if you have a half hour to kill their iced latte hits the spot. I just wish that they would have more sizes and or maybe coconut milk. But other than that, it was great.
author: Emma S.

description:
Hands down, best coffee I've had yet.  The NOLA iced coffee with almond milk (although a whopping $5) is 100% worth it.  My boyfriend and I were not sure what to expect when we came here, but were completely blown away.  I was so in love with it that I had to stop myself from drinking the whole thing in a few minutes!  My boyfriend was the opposite and made sure to savor every last drop.

We were able to find a spot at the table to relax that had a light breeze.  The area for the line is very short, so it seems to always be out the door.  But don't let this fool you - many people are getting to-go drinks and don't sit down to enjoy them.  It's a very small location, but suits the branding perfectly.  There's a lot of light wood and white, open, airy space.  I wouldn't plan on sitting here for very long, but you can easily hang out for 10-20 minutes.

Would come out of my way to go here again, even though it's in a bit of a random alleyway.  Might even want to buy some of their bagged coffee!
author: Kenna H.

description: I wanted to know what the hype was about Blue Bottle, so I decided to give it a try for breakfast. It is surprisingly very expensive for coffee and breakfast and I was not particularly impressed with the coffee. My server apologized after dropping my brioche bun on the countertop. A $12 breakfast sandwich and just plopped the brioche right in front of me. I accepted his apology and ate the sandwich despite this oversight. My assessment was that it was not as substantial nor flavorful than any other breakfast sandwich. The cafe latte was pretty middle of the road for coffee and not rich and flavorful nor full bodied. Seems like most of the patrons lived nearby and were a hipster type crowd. Paying exorbitant prices for average is not a priority in my life.
author: Alex C.

description:
"This coffee has notes of graham cracker. It reminds me of a warm hug." - Barista statements upon delivery of my siphon brew. It was truly like a warm hug. I've never had better coffee. Ever. I felt like I was tasting the first few sips like a fine wine.

I'm glad I took the time to stop here before heading out of town. I got to sit and relax with the warm sun reflecting through the windows and take 30 minutes for myself. Totally worth it.

They had the menu set out on a stand listing the options available. I felt like I had to try the siphon. So I opted for the Honduran roast - Santa Elena ($7). I may have also nabbed a bag of their single origin beans ($14) - impulse counter purchase. It smelled amazing. I went for the Honduras on a hunch. I typically prefer South American beans. I did not go wrong. The barista also told me this is her favorite right now so I was glad I did the right thing.

Things to note:
- There will most definitely be a line so be patient. It's worth it.
- Go for the siphon coffee or the funky Japanese approach. Lots of crazy contraptions for brewing. It's super cool.
- The space is small so be prepared to stand while waiting for a spot to open up or take your drink to go.
- They do have food. I didn't try anything though. Solely there for the coffee experience.
- This apparently is the best one so go here.
author: Breanna B.

description: I was a loyal BB customer for several years. I thought I would continue going after the recent buyout, but have unfortunately noticed a decline in the quality of the mochas. They were the best in the Bay Area, in my opinion. Looking elsewhere.
author: Adam T.

description:
Cute coffee shop tucked away in Mint Plaza. 

Visiting this Blue Bottle is a great way to get away from the bustling tourists around Powell and Union Square all while getting your caffeine fix. That said, this location does get pretty crowded, especially at noon. Expect a line through the door and maybe even around the shop. Given its popularity, the cafe doesn't seem like the best place to get some work done, but seats do turn over quickly even during the busiest of hours. 

Last time I visited I had the latte. At a bit over $4.50 this is one of the pricier lattes I've had, and it wasn't the best latte I've ever had, but it was definitely in the top 25%. That said, my friend ordered the mocha for just 50 cents more, and it was amazing. Not too sweet, but not bitter at all. The chocolate complimented the espresso so well. It was definitely the best mocha I have ever tried. On a warmer day you can't go wrong with the New Orleans Iced Coffee. This blue bottle also offers a handful of foods in case you get hungry (vegetarian options available!). 

In sum, a great place to get away from the tourists and grab a cup of jo with a friend or two.
author: Umeet S.

description: Very small shop for the amount of foot traffic they get. Tight and confined feeling inside. Line out the door, but also a little spillover pop up shop for pour overs. There's seating outside as long as you don't mind interacting with the shirtless transient talking to himself and asking you for money. Coffee is good but pricey.
author: Chris D.

description: True artisan coffee house. Great to watch and coffee very good. The crema was rich and full of flavor.
author: Michael C.

description: One of the best macchiatos I've ever taste... Excellent service btw. Oh! And if you're hungry you can try the blue bottle sandwich, it's so delicious.
author: Armando G.

description:
Intense. Might not be for everyone but I'm a fan:
Authentic
Strong
Bold
author: B U.

description:
Great place to eat and drink, be relaxed. I was traveling from my country: Japan and blue bottle got really popular in there, so I wanted to come this place during my stay in SF. In this place, you can drink good coffee and also eat some brunch. 

サンフランシスコで人気のブルーボトル、唯一グルメメニューが食べられる店舗です。日曜早朝7時から伺いましたが、すでに人の行列ができていました。とても地元民に愛されているのがわかる空間になっており、たくさんの地元民と観光客(特にアジア人)で賑わってます。美味しいコーヒーで朝の良いスタートが切れますよ！
author: Akira H.

description:
Expensive, but the coffee experience in a cup is worth every cent! 
This is what handcrafted coffee was meant to be. Forget about your run-of-the-mill coffee shops (Starbucks, Peet's, even Phyl'z), this is where real coffee lives. 

This particular place is crowded ALL.THE.TIME! Expect 10-15 min wait (line + service), but it's worth it! 

I've had cappuccinos, lattes, and mochas here. All delicious. They do NOT have chai lattes, which is my go-to drink when I'm not drinking coffee. 

Enjoy!
author: Rob G.

description:
Update 12/12/16: they have brought back Apple Pay! It's much easier for me to buy coffee here now. Thanks BB!

I love their coffee and the space is beautiful but it looks like they recently stopped taking Apple Pay, which is very inconvenient for me (my wallet isn't very accessible when I visit this location).

I'll update my review with 5 stars if they start taking it again.
author: Kyle J.

description: Great little spot on the corner! I ordered a cappuccino that was strong and smooth, hubby got a classic cold brew and it was strong and tart. They have us free finger cookies upon arriving because they were about to close, but the staff was super friendly and accommodating to us showing up at the time we did. They even offered us more free treats as we were walking out the door! Great little spot for intimate convos and a afternoon treat!
author: Laura R.

description: They make pretty good espresso based drinks but the food does seem overpriced for what it offers.
author: Arvind R.

description: Number one thing I heard while at Blue Bottle: " wow, is that the line for coffee?"  Good coffee, busy spot.
author: Bill K.

description:
DRINKS:
I love the mochas and lattes here! Other friends love their black coffees specifically the drip one. This place is where all the coffee snobs in SF come to hang out on the weekends and chit chat and talk about how this place compares to four barrel or ritual coffee. To me they all taste the same but that's because I am not a coffee snob lol! Inside I love the feel of the coffee shop but there is always a long line!!! Luckily if you only order the black coffee you can get that one outside. It's great for all those impatient people who hate waiting ! 

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? Yes try the latte if you like sweet drinks!
author: Kelley Y.

description: Went during a weekend weekend afternoon and as expected it was super packed. I know many people search for ~hip~ and ~cool~ and ~trendy~ coffee shops to set up shop and get working but I definitely wouldn't recommend this place for that. Though it is all of those traits and more, it's probably not the best environment for that. As busy as it was, the staff was still extremely nice and patient with my mixed up order. Great quality drinks!!
author: Lisa H.

description:
This was my first time trying Blue Bottle.  I came here with a regular who recommended I get the New Orleans style, which, when I checked Yelp, seemed to be the most recommended drink as well.  I usually take my coffee black, but the splash of milk to the New Orleans style drink, was actually a very nice touch and made the drink a little more smooth and less drying on the palette.  The coffee itself was very bright, but not too acidic, and nice and crisp with spicy notes.  Served iced, it was a great, refreshing summer drink.

The atmosphere of the coffee shop was great too - huge, open windows that let in a lot of light.  A lot of sitting room to chat with friends or to work quietly.  The barista bar was very active, which I always find really entertaining to watch.  Would definitely come again!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I'm a huge fan of all things New Orleans and Blue Bottle's New Orleans cold brew continues to live up to the hype ($4.65 total). Simultaneously bitter and sweet to taste but not over the top. I opted for nonfat milk this time around and it still tasted great, but I'd recommend whole milk if that's in your wheelhouse.

Food: I try not to make eye contact with the baked goods because they look divine.  

Vibe: Hipster/minimalist with some sophistication. Not pretentious. 

Service: Beards, piercings, tattoos all accompany friendly faces. I trust the expertise without feeling intimidated. 

Highlight: Ambiance...I can carry on a conversation here, I can escape from the hustle and bustle of Market St here, I can breathe here.

Lowlight: No WiFi...if I'm splurging for coffee, I should be able to scroll through Instagram. Just come up with a clever network name and be done with it.

Shhhh don't tell anyone I prefer this over the Oakland location (Broadway)!
author: Mary B.

description: Very busy place, but one of the best coffee shops in Union Square that's worth the experience!
author: Raghad T.

description: Not worth it!!!  Over price...coffee too bitter.  Your paying the price of a venti frap for a small cup of coffee.
author: Nelson B.

description: I was in the area for vacation and had this coffee shop recommended by a friend. The atmosphere was wonderful, lots of open and airy space. Great lighting and cute views of the scenic homes nearby (great for someone like me who enjoys too many photos of their food). I had ordered the cafe latte (largest size drink on the menu = most caffeine hopefully) and was ecstatic over the adorable foam design. I also ordered the avocado toast, which was almost too pretty to eat. The toast had a nice balance of mostly savory and a little sweet. I will be craving this toast when I go back home! The iced coffee was fun to watch the brewing process, like nothing I've seen before but the coffee itself was a bit of an odd flavor for me. The staff was friendly and quick to clear my plate, definitely wish this chain branches out to my area! Go! Go!
author: Hannah M.

description: The breakfast was really good and so was the coffee. I recommend the avocado toast and add a poached egg. So goooooddddddd
author: Sanaz T.

description: Vegan breakfast (that is not avocado toast) is always weirdly hard to find. I appreciated Blue Bottle's protein rich offerings of toast with almond butter , and also the overnight oats with a medley of tasty things on top. There was also a chia pudding.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I love this quaint coffee shop. Line was out the door when I arrived so I knew it had to be good. Definitely worth the wait!
author: Brittany E.

description: I love the feels of this place along with great coffee and food. If you can grab a seat by the bar, you'll enjoy and appreciate your cup of coffee a little more. I really loved the avocado toast.
author: Teanna T.

description:
Update: Blue bottles customer service contacted me about my experience below. I highly appreciate great customer service and companies that care about their customers. I will definitely consider trying them again and possibly selecting something different on the menu. Stay tuned.
---
Honestly this coffee is extremely bitter and extremely over priced. On the bright side the ambiance and look and feel of the shop is nice but this is definitely over hyped.
author: Jonelle C.

description: Portions are large, food was fast and tasty.   Tried both a special and seasonal muffin, both were great.  Line was long but with two people got seats in about 15 minutes on a Saturday at 9:30.
author: Tim C.

description: It was worth the wait! New Orleans cold brew was delicious and the avocado toast was incredible!
author: Jillian N.

description:
Oh Blue Bottle and my love/hate relationship with you. Love because I genuinely do think that their coffee is amazing and that the baristas take a lot of effort to get things right...but hate because it's always so busy.

I haven't figured out why it takes 15 minutes to get a coffee when there are like a THOUSAND people working at any given time, but I've learned to accept it and am thankful for whatever magic they're putting into their coffee.

The Americano is smooth, bold and strong without being overwhelming or bitter- and you can't go wrong with any of their iced coffees.

Just be prepared to wait!
author: Elliott W.

description:
Best. Latte. Ever. EVER.  
Doesn't even need sugar.  Sweet, rich, delicious. No bitterness. 
If I was local, I'd drink one every single day.
author: Basil M.

description: Second visit to Blue Bottle. New Orleans ice coffee and hot cappuccino were the best so far.
author: Yeseul S.

description: Awesome coffee experience..get the siphon, well worth the wait!!  Staff was wonderful.  Will be back for more
author: Brian B.

description: Great place to grab a quick lunch or a coffee and snacks. Slightly on the pricier side.
author: Ed Y.

description:
I go to the finest coffee bars and am very appreciative of excellent coffee. I have no complaints about the coffee here. 

I resent being charged $7 for a red eye (coffee with an added shot). No other fine coffee shop -- not JoeCoffee NewYork, Intelligentsia, 9th Street Espresso etc. -- charges full price for an "add a shot." It's totally wrong, obnoxious and infuriating.

If anyone reads these Yelp reviews, I have been trying to get the message to BB's management for awhile now.
author: Laurel T.

description:
Coffee is some of the best in town. 
I tried the avocado toast with poached eggs and a cafe late this morning and I'm in heaven.

Two years later thee avocado toast has gone from a work of art to something your mother would make you before she makes your peanut butter sandwich or lunch. 
Coffee is good.
author: Dan R.

description:
Literally 10 steps from our place at the Hampton Inn - Blue Bottle was our first choice on a rainy morning for some amazing java.  I typically get a Breve latte when I travel; not sure why, but it's like my special treat.  What a treat it was - half and half was not steamed to a curdled oblivion, and wonderful espresso base rounded out this solid drink.

As impressive was watching the gravity fed cold-brewed coffee in action (very slowly) and being to effortlessly interact with the baristas as they prepared their concoctions.
We missed a line, but one formed out the door quickly (which as you can see from Google earth pic, is common).
author: Patrick K.

description:
Oh my stars. This place is good but oh so busy!
Even on a rainy rainy Sunday morning!
The lines are crazy and seating is near impossible but the food is yummy and coffee beautiful.

I got the eggs, cauliflower and toast breakfast and a cappuccino - no complaints and my friend and I were lucky enough to nab an amazing bar seat right near the siphoning action.

Note to self to try the $8 siphoned coffee.  We heard it's most delicious and obvi served hot to provide the best flavor.  Additionally, as it cools the taste transforms.  The way it's made is worth watching too.  Fun!  

You can buy beans and cookbooks as you enter and don't forget the lids are in the corner to the left, opposite the door/register.  

--vv happy customer
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Too sad that Blue Bottle sold its soul to the devil, i.e. the Nestle Company. I used to have a subscription but due to above sale I cancelled it. Now it is just like Starbucks, Peets, Stumptown Coffee, etc. 

Regards,
author: Brenda M.

description:
Heaven on every level.. 
The wait can take a little while, but if it's good coffee, it's totally worth it... 
Seating can be kind of a pinch, but something always opens up! 
We love Blue Bottle! 
Definitely worth it!
author: Heather A.

description:
This has become my absolute favorite coffee.

I've heard about this place for a long time and I'm a big fan of ice coffee which they happen to be famous for.

Tried the Three Africas Drip Coffee and it was AMAZING. 

It's 7.37am now and I'm planning what time I should be there for coffee before I fly out of SFO..
author: Jive O.

description:
This place is okay. I got a sandwich and a mocha they were good but I've had significantly better before.  

What I didn't care for is the line moves slowly. The place is also very chaotic; there are a lot of people in the shop walking through which means you constantly have to get out of someones way or vice versa. The seating in the shop is also full and there isn't another location near by to sit down at either (like a park). The staff could be more polite, as well. 

It definitely did not live up to the hype.
author: Rose P.

description: Simply the best tasting espresso I have ever had. To describe it would require me to go into pseudo wine connoisseur territory -- the complexity! the note of [leather product], touches of [tobacco product], a hint of [stone fruit type thingy]. I won't go there. But that's what this coffee deserves. It's just that good.
author: Michael B.

description:
This is the largest and nicest Blue Bottle location I have been to with both indoor as well as outdoor seating and some small meal items which other locations don't have.
Service was nice, it was super busy so there was a bit of a wait.
Prices are steep, but the quality is fantastic, I went with the mocha as always, such a great combination and they real, rich chocolate they use makes all the difference.
One of the places I have to go every time I am in SF!
author: Nijole T.

description:
Very good hot chocolate:
- not too hot
- looks like coffee
- tastes real - I mean real chocolate with some milk!!!

Perfect - Thx
author: Alex G.

description: This is a prime example of how customer service is crucial to a good experience. I love this place, I love their coffee, and I usually love the service. Today was different.
author: Andres P.

description:
What a different experience for getting my coffee made. Only in San Francisco or New York can you get this kind of experience. 

For coffee, it's moderately priced but add in the entertainment factor and each staffer's knowledge and it's well worth it.
author: Randy L.

description: Found this place on yelp. It was a close walk from our hotel. I had the caffe latte and I thought it was delicious. The employees were friendly. I will definitely return when in San Fran again!
author: Lupe S.

description: I love love blue bottle! Tried for the first time and fell in love with it. Do check out th avocado toast. It looked simple but it taste awesome! Highly recommended!
author: Michelle T.

description: This is a great coffee shop located in a quiet spot of central San Francisco. The place is nicely decorated, service is quick and very friendly. The atmosphere here is very relaxed and comfortable. All the classic coffee drinks are on the menu and done professionally by the Barista. For sure they know what they are doing. Good value for money!
author: Hans C.

description:
It is what it is: hyped hipster 101 in the City.  Great espresso every time.  Ground Zero for Gentrification.  

The facts: excellent drinks and nerdy expertise with a smile.  The kitchen is solid and the bathrooms are clean.

More facts:  BB wants to keep you moving.  No WiFi and the music is louder than necessary.  Wood bar stools and narrow passages.

Take your hometown friends from out of town.  Meaning you are from out of town and pretend to be a Native of  the City until your friends from "back home" show up and then you really turn it on and take them to the Mint Building for a taste of your city.
author: Timothy H.

description:
Hipster coffee place in SF. The place is actually pretty hard to find--it's tucked away in a corner off of main mission st, so you really have to know where you're going to find it.

Was there ever any doubt that this was a hipster coffee place? Just walk in and look at the clientele and it should be obvious! But! this isn't one of those snobby hipster coffee places--in fact, the waitstaff and the clientele there seems to be pretty nice, randomly apologizing etc. The decor inside looks clean, modern, and a black-and-white kind of feel, and yet still feels friendly.

The coffee quality was great, as expected. I got the latte, which had a really good latte art on top, and tasted very frothy, and warm. Apparently you can get an almond milk version of the latte--will try next time.

Will definitely come back to visit again
author: Henry L.

description: A little bit hard to find but once you get there it's so Worthy. I'm very impressed by their clear, simple and distinctive branding and design tho. Latte is good, cappuccino is good, also I love their cascara fizz !
author: Tiffany C.

description: The New Orleans Ice coffee is amazing! I don't drink coffee a lot but this is one of those places that you have to try at least once. It is so refreshing!
author: Saideep S.

description:
Wow, this place is exactly what I was looking for  (but don't often find when visiting this country where the natives think Starbucks makes good coffee..)
Funky layout, welcoming baristas, trendy clientele, balmy breeze wafting through..
Oh, and the cappuccino is seriously Good!!!
author: Dara B.

description: Came... and left.  Not sure how this is better than Starbucks.  At least Starbucks has seats, more options, better prices and loyalty rewards.  Don't come with a bunch of folks/kids unless you want to take it to go
author: Susannah K.

description: I visited twice in a week!!  The first time I tried the avocado toast, good!!  The 2nd time I had the pouched egg toast, too much salt.  Coffee was ok!  I do really like the design of my latte; however it wasn't very creamy...  I would give it a 4 star if they make a small improvement of the food.
author: Jess R.

description:
Yeesh ka beesh, this place has a long line! We came at 4pm on a weekday and waited 15+ minutes for our drinks. 

This is clearly a popular place to meet- for business interactions or a friendly catch up. The staff is very friendly. There's limited seating inside (1 long table and side window sill seats), yet there are some outside tables. Also, this location is near a business centre square with plenty of tables and seats. I like how this location is a bit off the main bustling areas (i.e. Market Street), sorta in a not-so-hidden nook. There's a strong weed smell in the hood, though that's not to the fault of Blue Bottle.

I'm not a coffee drinker, so I got their genmaichi green tea for $3. Freshly brewed tea- I digged the rich earthiness. All my coffee lovin' compadres love Blue Bottle coffee, so I recommend going to a SF branch if you're in the area.
author: Joanna L.

description: Blue Bottle is similar to other coffee shops in SF in the sense that it was hipster. When we came the line was out the door but moved fairly quickly. I got the New Orleans and at first I didn't think it would be THAT great as a lot of my friends said. When I took my first sip I had to add a bit of sweetener since i'm not the "I like my coffee black" type of person. However, it was some of the best coffee I had since it's not watered down/flavored with too much sugar compared to what you would get at a larger chain coffee shop. I got the almond rocher too and it paired really well with the coffee.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Holy Moly this place is HEAVEN ON EARTH. I don't drink coffee so I have never heard of blue bottle coffee. My friend and I were visiting San Fran and she requested to go eat here. I got the hot chocolate and the avocado toast with poached eggs. I'm in LA and crave it all. The. Time.
author: Sanaz A.

description: Love love LOVE!!! One of the best coffee places that is on par with my favourite artisan coffee spots in Vancouver. Love the lemonade for the non-caffeine option and they make a fantastic mocha.
author: Evelyn Y.

description: I tend to frequent this Blue Bottle because it's quite close to my workplace. My go to drink is the New Orleans cold brew, but I do occasionally get a mocha if the cold weather is raging outside. To be honest, I haven't had a drink at Blue Bottle that I have disliked. Lines here can get a bit egregious so I would account for that if you're looking for something super quick to grab. They do have an outside coffee station set up at times which can help move the line along. *Hint: if you get the cold brews, they just came out at the register for you so your wait time for your actual drink is pretty non-existent. However, you'll still have to wait in line to order so there's that.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Hidden location on Mint street. The location is a bit small with some bar tables for dining in. The staff are all very friendly but the drinks take a bit to come out. They have a limited selection of drip coffees for my husband to choose from but I enjoyed my mocha. It wasn't too sweet. Overall, I see us coming here whenever we are in the city. They also have a little cart outside where you can order coffee. It was cold when we were in SF so we opted to wait inside.
author: Sarah C.

description: Come for the best oji coffee and avo/egg toast everytime I'm in SF.  Plan ahead for lines.
author: Nancy T.

description:
The quality has gone downhill before Nestle took over. I still go here as there is no better downtown option. 

Huge space but the line can get really long when it reaches the corner. 

Perhaps I just go here for the cute baristas?



FYI, leave your cups and plates on the table instead of trying to pass it to the people making your coffee. Someone will come around to pick up the dirty dishes.
author: Evan W.

description: This Blue Bottle was my first coffee stop when I moved to San Francisco and it remains my favorite downtown coffee shop in SF. If you don't mind the occasional flood of tourists this Blue Bottles tall ceilings and embrace of an old structure whose windows let in tons of light really make this a fun place to get breakfast on a Saturday morning. My favorite poached eggs in the city (get the Poached Eggs on Toast and add avocado) and even though the used to discourage you from it one of my favorite iced lattes in the city. (Sorry the new orleans is good but its an entirely different experience) A few of the staff members have been there for along time and they tend to know my name and order even when I haven't been for a while. It is in a bit of a seedy area but their security staff is on top of things. Just make sure you don't set your laptop in an open window - Its just far too easy for someone to snatch from outside in a way that would be impossible for you to stop. It's not the first Blue Bottle but it's the best Blue Bottle.
author: Justin S.

description:
There was a line out the door but it went pretty quickly. The staff was friendly, and the latte I ordered was delicious. 
There aren't any outlets, so doing work there was a bit of a challenge ~ come with any electronics fully charged! I had no issues finding a seat, which was a pleasant surprise. I didn't feel hurried to leave and was able to sit and enjoy my time there. 
Bonus, there was a cute barista there, so that was fun :)
I'd return to this cafe for sure.
author: K.e. B.

description: I happen to stumble across this place in san francisco city while strolling around with a friend. It's a very small cosy place at the corner of a building. Their coffee is too good and its different from the usual coffee.
author: Bhawna J.

description: Great coffee I became familiar with on a last trip, convenient location with plenty of space inside and a plethora of outdoor seating. Just don't try to use cash here - took 5 x longer than it should based on "a lot of counterfeit bills lately"
author: Michael J.

description: One of the coffee shops that I really like. The coffee machines Blue Bottle has is pretty interesting l. This coffee shop is a really nice place for sitting down with a friend on a afternoon and just catching up kind of place. I got the affogato taste really good, but the espresso is definitely really strong, (and this is coming from a person that loves coffee and always drinks it). But it was definely something different and worth a try. The coffee is definitely something I would need during midterm and finals week to keep me up. But the coffee mixed with ice cream is really silky and rich and it's like more towards the sweeter side from the ice cream, but the coffee taste is still there. Overall, I give it a 5, because I really like it, and the affogato coffee is something different and eye opening for me and I really like it.
author: Angela C.

description: Probably the best coffee I have ever had.  It was a very smooth mocha.  The oatmeal was great too.  It is busy in here but totally wait the wait for coffee!!
author: Abbas B.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is somewhat interior and if you are going there for the first time, you may have slight trouble in locating this place.

Coffee is great here.  I tried Latte.  There are a good number of breakfast options available.  I didn't take breakfast but, their presentation looked neat!

It doesn't feel like a regular coffee shop.  This place seems to be very popular and the crowd is  dense.  There is not much room to move around.  You may find it hard to navigate between two benches.  

A bit pricey compared to a typical coffee shop but, totally worth the coffee+experience.  For a regular catch up or a coffee run, this place is great.  But, I had a professional catch up and after the fact it didn't feel like it was a good idea to meet here, mainly because of the crowd and the noise.
author: Srinath S.

description: What a sell out, and boutique or local no more! Of all mega corporations, to sell to Nestle one has to be low, selfish, and not care about small businesses. The same small business Blue Bottle was, but clearly without the ethos. Just another Starbucks!
author: Mick J.

description:
I love Blue Bottle, but this location is lacking. It's often very crowded with not a lot of spots to sit or even wait for your coffee to come up. Additionally, twice I've been here and they've gotten my order wrong, or forgotten it entirely. 

If you're in this area and want a great coffee or tea--definitely pay a visit to Blue Bottle and hope for the best! I recommend the New Orleans coffee or the black tea.
author: Kate T.

description: This update is for the customer service and the coffee.  They were quick to follow up on my concerns.  Which I appreciate it.  It means that they still care about their customers and value their input. However, I still wouldn't get the muesli again!
author: Mz S.

description: I've been a fan of Blue Bottle for a long time - and this is the best place to get my ice coffee fix! If you're hungry in the morning, don't fret - you can grab a yogurt with granola or a delicious arugula salad. I love this location as you get a totally different vibe than the other coffee shops around, or even the other Blue Bottle locations for that matter. I just wish I could live this awesome area!
author: Michelle V.

description: Very good coffee. I has a cappucino and I liked it a lot.  Was is significantly better than Peets or Starbucks? Based on my 1 visit, I'd say no.I'll be back though.
author: Michael M.

description: The service was really great, they welcomed us in and asked if we had any concerns or questions they would able to assist. We had a few questions and gave us a sample of their oji, which is a really strong and concentrated Japanese style coffee. We ordered the New Orleans, single original, and a pound cake. The New Orleans was their most caffeinated drink but really good and smooth. Their single original was strong but good. Their pound cake really outstanding, it wasn't too dry or moist, right in that sweet spot. It also wasn't too sweet or just a biscuit. I give this place an overall 5/5 for service and product.
author: Matthew S.

description: The only Blue Bottle that I know of that offers this extent of real food options. Very loud but that didn't bother me on this visit.
author: Joshua R.

description: Awesome beans, especially talking about their cold brew
author: 佳宁

description: The Oji was great! Delicate yet a Deep complexity to it! I don't usually like ice coffee since it lacks the aroma of a fresh brewed but this was still superb! The venue is modern and chic as well!
author: Tomoki T.

description:
Started coming here when this place had just opened, and it was fantastic. The coffee and food was superb, the employees were extremely kind and knowledgeable. 

Now, it's a rebranded Starbucks. If you're not ordering a crappucino, a macchishitto, or anything with milky it takes FOREVER. People who were at the back of a 20 person line get their coffee first when I ordered a ESPRESSO!! Freeman, wake up, growth doesn't matter if you're not running a tight ship at these places.
author: Aaron S.

description: Sometimes it takes forever here, but usually worth it. When someone took my coffee by accident, they refunded me AND gave me a new coffee on the house. Great service!
author: Anees L.

description:
This coffee shop has almost no redeeming features besides it's proximity to my hotel. $3.50 for a small cup of overly acidic drip coffee that was served with a complimentary side of smugness. I realize we're all sad and angry over Donald but coffee is supposed to make people happy! Get it together guys. 
The music is so loud they cannot hear or therefore get anyone's name correct, which only furthers their pretentious "I'm cooler than you" attitude. 
No wifi? Really? It's 2016 and this is a coffee shop! I suppose they're looking to deter the work-from-home crowd but as a traveler from out of town this was a major bummer. If only they knew their mediocre service and dry overpriced pastries did that for them! Nicest part was my interaction with the bus girl who was polite and pleasant.
author: Theresa A.

description:
Impressive, most impressive, but it is not my favorite coffee yet. A small spacious spot located inconspicuously in the middle of nowhere. It was a treasure to find though! Thank you G.P.S. and my attentive eyes!

- Upon walking in, you'll notice that, this is not your typical coffee shop. Lots of lighting and welcoming bright white painted walls. As small as this place really is, it feels open with all the tall windows. There is a communal table in the middle with several high bar seats. 

- The New Orleans' Iced Coffee I got was simply amazing. Who knew, iced coffee could be so good? I love how people are able to see how their dripped coffee is being made with these " science experimenting looking coffee makers"

- The people working there appear to love what they are doing. They were friendly and inviting. Kept their composure and grace when handling the long line. They were hip and cool!

- This place gets busy really quickly. Not the ideal spot to read a book or study. 

Would have to come back again and try their other drinks!
author: Jim G.

description:
Worst coffee experience ever. 

9 employees behind the counter. 18 customers. I ordered 2 drip coffees to go. At any other coffee shop I could have finished them both by the time I got them. TEN MINUTES to pour two cups of plain drop coffee in two to go cups. 

And the coffee was just ok. And barely hot. 

And what's the deal with sugar only. Ok, so the blue stuff and the pink stuff cause cancer. How about a little pure stevia?? 

Never again.
author: Michael M.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee has got to be the sexiest coffee company in my book! I have been to almost all of their locations in the city, and there is a "coolness" to each of them. This location next to the Mint Plaza is even sexier than I remembered.  Even the regulars have a sexy "Blue Bottle Swag" look about them.  I have also noticed through the years that Blue Bottle has quite a unique followers.  These Blue Bottle Coffee gurus proves to have a sophisticated taste buds... that only those who truly appreciates what good coffee is all about! For you "Folgers" connoisseurs, don't let that discourage you.

I have had their pour over coffee many times.  I drink mine black and my experience so far have been fantastic.  What stands out from the rest is the way they make their cappuccino.  It must be a secret recipe because it's quite addicting, hypnotic more like!  

Tips
-- have patience (lines move quick)
-- explore your taste bud (don't just stick to one drink over and over)
-- they offer more than just coffee at this location including brunch
-- this location has outdoor seatings
--wifi included
--a few steps away, you can savor your beverage in front of the Mint Plaza
-- Westfield Mall is just across the street
-- parking can be tough and you are better off using the 5th & Mission Garage.

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
author: Edwin R.

description: A must go to place if you're in the BAY area. Just trust me and go experience it yourself.
author: Katherine K.

description: This is the place to go for a nice quick breakfast, reminds me so much of NYC . Clean and great ambience. I ordered the toast with poached eggs and the cashier recommended to add avocado and bacon paired with a nice cup of hot cappuccino. Since I lost La Boulange ... I'm in a mission to look for that one perfect breakfast place. This may or may not be the one ... but it can do for now .
author: Sandra R.

description: Don't get me wrong.  The small almond latte was beautifully crafted by the barista, but the quality of the coffee was just ok.  I also think that charging $6.24 for this small cup of latte is just ridiculous.  I'll stick with The Equator.  I can still get great small soy lattes there for a fair price.
author: Maria G.

description: Great atmosphere and usually long queue. But you won't be disappointed. Locally sourced and they even directly pass on the employee healthcare cost as an additional tax. +1 for supporting their employees right.
author: Aakash C.

description: I used to love this place.  Good coffee, pleasant service people, nice Oakland location.  Even when it got bought by Nestle, I decided to still get an occasional coffee if the policies and coffee did not change. I am allergic to cow's milk and need an alternative creamer. Then they stopped carrying soy milk for which they did not charge extra and added almond and oat for which they now charge a dollar! extra which brings the price of a cappuccino to $5.25. I know this is a first world issue but I am not going to pay that much when I know the cost of almond milk.  Basically the extra cost for almond milk compared to cow's milk is about 35 cents so if they want to charge 50 cents ok but $1 is just ridiculous.  so goodbye Blue Bottle--and now I am one step closer to avoiding Nestle completely.
author: Connie C.

description: Nice location. The coffee extraction seemed a bit off (yes, I drink it black, roast my own beans, brew at home using a variety of methods) but altogether was pleased with this location. It's pretty nondescript in its decor and the staff were friendly, greeting me as I entered and bidding me farewell when I left. The prices may surprise you if you're not used to it but overall good shop.
author: Tom M.

description: This place is hidden in the back area of Mint alley. The shop is very cute and the guy that helped us was very nice. Got several different bags of whole bean coffee, a little pricey but it's worth every penny! The coffee beans smell so good when you walk into the coffee shop.
author: Magz K.

description:
Dear Blue Bottle Coffee,

I ordered two coffee grounds-Giant Steps and Bella Donovan to try at home. I must say you have the BEST coffee EVER!
author: Mary S.

description:
I ordered a siphon which was really good and got me going in the morning ...I am from LA and they only have their blend for some reason so it was definitely a positive experience being able to try a single origin coffee
I also had a bread with poached eggs with a side of marmalade which was really delicious.
Recommend also trying their hot chocolate..one of the best I've had in California
author: Luis E M.

description: Being a tourist in California, it was my first time trying blue bottle. Amazing coffee - I highly recommend the iced latte!
author: Reema K.

description: Love Blue Bottle!!  Location was clean, staff were super friendly. Definitely for people who enjoy a wonderful java and don't mind paying for it.
author: Kevin S.

description: Super acidic coffee and I have never really like the flavor. I know folks go bananas for Blue Bottle and in an outsider not liking it at all. Still, the staff here are very nice and you can tell they work hard to get you what you want.
author: Melissa D.

description:
Saturday, 10:00 AM.

Quickie:
+ Food quality
* Service
* Hygiene
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
* Menu variety

And then...?
We're rooting for you Blue Bottle, keep doing your thing so you can expand.

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. New Orleans Iced Coffee
     + Dances between bitter n' sweet
author: Chuck N.

description:
Big line up. Wondered if it was going to be worth the 20+ minute wait.  Simply, it was.  Clean smooth coffee. 
Who knew it could be so good!?
author: Brad W.

description: Might be one of the best places to get a cup of joe and take in the City....highly recommend the Blue Bottle!!!
author: Mark B.

description:
This spot used to be a refuge when I worked downtown. Today I got to stop by again on my way to jury duty - was hoping this would be the bright spot on a full day.

The verdict?
Coffee: Sub-Par. Not bad, just not worth the added wait, cost, hype. Not as good as I remember it. Maybe other roasters have surpassed them?

The Breakfast Sando: It was decent. The bun was kinda dry and there was no distinct flavor. It was on par with a generic cafe bfast sando that would cost five buck... BUT THIS COST $12!! Twelve! For a mediocre breakfast sandwich?! 

I could have gone to the f---ing McDonald's next to the courthouse and gotten an equally satisfying sando and coffee for $5 instead of $16.
author: Ross H.

description: Not that great. Based on all the Yelp reviews, we were excited to get breakfast here. When we got there, we were dissapointed to see a menu that did not include many of the items we saw on Yelp. We ordered an espresso, latte, oatmeal and breakfast sandwich. We were underwhelmed. Bottom line, the staff was friendly and fast but the food and coffee wasn't anything to rave about.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Huh. I mean yes, the atmosphere at Blue Bottle Coffee Co here on Mint St. is unlike essentially any coffee shop I've ever been to, but when it comes to the product? I wasn't blown away given the prices and the hype. Good? Yes. A-OK? Certainly, but nothing incremental over that in my opinion. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Again, the atmosphere at Blue Bottle is brilliant, and there's a good reason why it's been branded all across the city and the state. The high ceilings in this historic building are gorgeous, and the white theme with the classy accents makes you feel important - as if you could actually afford to live in this part of town! Service is fast and friendly, and even when there's a line they can burn through it pretty quickly. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

I'll be honest - I was worried when I walked in. Great location? Classy decor? Am I about to spend a small fortune on an iced coffee? "$4". "$4? As in, less than $5?" Be still my heart. This was affordable folks (all things considered), and while my New Orleans Style Iced Coffee was pretty small portion wise, this really wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be. It's all about expectation I suppose. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

My New Orleans Style iced coffee was good, but I was in the unique position of having just had a similar iced coffee from nearby Philz (http://www.yelp.com/biz/philz-coffee-san-francisco-4), which was, admittedly, better in terms of flavor, temperature, and size. The New Orleans style iced coffee here at Blue Bottle was a bit on the bitter side, and while I like that, it's not what I'm used to when someone mentions new orleans style iced coffee that's traditionally sweetened with a bit of cane sugar and cinnamon. Again, this was good, but not the best I've had. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

I get why Blue Bottle has become such an establishment here in SFO, and I get why this location in particular gets so much attention, but at the end of the day, I've had better coffee here in the city. No Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
My favorite coffee (and breakfast shop) when I'm in SF.

As someone who's been spoilt for coffee back in Australia, It's always nice to see places thats not starbucks (which I'll only go for the wifi, frappuchinos, or I've got a starbucks card to use up).

Yes there's sometimes a line, but as all good things its worth the wait.

The breakfast here is also pretty good too (hot and cold one).
author: Barry T.

description: I'm very confused as to why this cafe has a 4.2 star rating. It's very mediocre coffee for very fancy prices. The ice in my iced latte was a stick of ice that filled half the cup, and even with their simple syrup it wasn't sweet. Disappointingly small menu. Crowded. It's basically in a back ally of downtown SF. I'm a local and I've had some good coffee in the city-- this is not one of those places. But, the baristas are nice and the place is clean, I'll give them that.
author: Maria K.

description:
Blue never cease to amaze me! Consistent with the quality of their coffee. I use to go to the Ferry Building location but so glad I found this one on Mint. Don't have to crowd with the tourists and great large communal table to sit and enjoy your coffee. 
I tried their shortbread and almond rocher and both were amazing especially with my cappuccino. What a great start to my morning! ;)

This place gets super busy. I'm sure that's the case for all Blue locations.
author: Hanah P.

description:
This store is very unfriendly , their attitude to serve costumers is very unprofessional .

Rude is the only description that I have offer.
author: 程

description: Excellent food and drink. No internet and a bit pricey.
author: Patrick O.

description:
While the coffee itself is superb as always, this particular location receives possibly my lowest rating due to the blatently disappointing service. 

Not only were the employees unfriendly and appear uninterested, they were inefficiently slow, making everyone in the tiny shop line out the door or tightly cram inside to wait for their order which was just leisurely being made. I've never seen such lazy, half-hearted effort from employees at a Blue Bottle. 

What was most annoying was how much fun the three employees were having laughing and engrossed in their conversations, yet when asked a question or clarification, they were quick to be snarky and irritated! 

It took a long while for us to get a Macchiato and a Caffe Mocha, and the employee at the pick up station softly called out the names and just put drinks out with a very careless and apathetic "have a nice day."

Overall, cramped location, unkempt cream/sugar station inconveniently placed in the back corner, and terribly unprofessional service. If you're in the SOMA and crave Blue Bottle, the location itself is quietly tucked away which is nice, but it all depends if you're willing to go through the wait.

I will leave this review on a positive note though: that the coffee was definitely not as bitter as I was.
author: Kyrie S.

description:
No matter what time you come expect a line out the door! The place is tucked away in between a couple of buildings, cute looks industrial. Food and coffee are both packed with flavor. I ordered a regular latte, lemon pound cake, and match green tea. 

Food:
-Good sized
-Flavorful
-Pastries and regular food available
Wait time:
-Twenty minutes to order
-Five minutes to receive food

Parking:
-None

Bathrooms:
-You need a key but there are restrooms available!

Atmosphere:
-Bustling. Music is a little loud but soulful.
author: Chhaya N.

description: Out-of-towners.  No Starbucks for us.  Stopped in for a local pour-over.  No complaints on the coffee.  Decent cup.  BUT, Soooooo Slooooow.  30 minutes in line.  Cannot believe we stood there.  Great if you don't have to wait, but not worth it otherwise.  Also, very pretentious cashier and unclear menu (no description of what coffee is available for the pour-over).  Should have hit Phil's instead.
author: Adam S.

description:
Great location at Mint Plaza with Union Square and Westfield Shopping Center within walking distance from here. Friendly staff members, clean facility, good coffee and service. New Orleans Iced Coffee is available in carton packaging and hand crafted versions. Overall, I enjoyed my experiences here.
Restrooms are available, just ask for key from the baristas or security guard.
*I don't recall seeing the security guard here from my previous visits, but it's always good to see his presence though.

During both visits, I didn't see a line or it was very short and there was also a place to stand or sit. This was indeed quite a surprise to me because during previous visits at both locations, I saw a long line and limited seating. If you are looking for really good coffee with culinary creativity, look no further than Blue Bottle Coffee. I absolutely and honestly disclose their coffee is really good. Coffee this good, the wait is worthwhile regardless of it being 10-20 minutes.

05/29/2014:
New Orleans Iced Coffee (Carton Version) with Belgian Waffle - perfect for the anytime quick fix. I absolutely like the butter and syrup mixed in with the waffle because it's so delicious. Overall, good food, good service, clean facility and friendly staff team.

10/07/2014:
New Orleans Iced Coffee - one of my favorites here at Blue Bottle Coffee. I said I was going to try the handcrafted version, so I finally did. It was very good! TCHO Chocolate is available here - Chocolate and Cappuccino blended together? New twist and this Chocolate pairs well with Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Bennett W.

description: Good coffee, quick service. I'm not a coffee connoisseur but I enjoyed what I ordered and it kept me caffeinated for the day.
author: Emily R.

description:
The location is beautiful with all the big windows and white walls, but not a place I would want to sit at all day. I noticed a lot of different accents being spoken around me, such diversity sipping on this coffee.

Behind the iPad register, the smiley barista was friendly and asked a few questions about my coffee preferences and then got me a New Orleans Iced Coffee. Coffee is simple here, but it's been perfected. (I guess I just don't like iced coffee?) What I liked about the coffee lady, she was personable! She talked about how she's from Walnut Creek and got my molasses cookie (a great pairing with the iced coffee by the way)

It's good, but not a place that I'd crave. It's not necessarily an experience or anything I'm writing home about.

Next!
author: Monique W.

description:
This shop is amazing. Sunday morning looking for an early coffee and I wanted to go here last time I was in SF but didn't get the chance.
