Showed up around 8am on Sunday and it was decently full, but no line for the register. We ordered the yogurt and granola, a breakfast sandwich, and a latte as well as one of the siphons (that I can't remember the name of, and they change every so often as well). The siphon was $7 for a small, but she said a small was definitely enough for two, so I ended up having a latte and a little less than half of the siphon.

We found a place by the siphons and the Oji drip machine and were just in awe of everything going on. It's a lot of fun to watch them make the siphon coffee if you haven't seen it before. The yogurt and granola as well as the breakfast sandwich were also incredible. The sandwich had very fluffy bread and a delicious frittata along with bacon and arugula, which was solid and unique from the breakfast sandwiches I'm used to. It was definitely on the pricey side ($12), but it was really good. The yogurt and granola was a generous portion and was also quite delicious. The latte I had (not a huge coffee drinker) was very well done, not too milky at all and definitely not burnt.

Now onto the siphon, which was incredible. As I said, I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but watching them make this was intriguing and the product was delicious. I usually drink coffee for the caffeine and dislike straight coffee, but this had interesting aromas and flavors in it. The flavors were butterscotch, orange citrus, and tobacco aftertaste, and I could actually taste them all which is crazy because I don't have a very developed sense of taste when it comes to coffee.

They accidentally missed our ticket at first (adding like 3 minutes to a 5 minute process) but we didn't even notice because were were so engrossed just watching and enjoying the food. They came over and offered us a free pastry which we politely declined but they were very kind about a small screw up which was a huge plus for me.

After one visit this is one of my favorite coffee shops and I will definitely go back.
author: Matt B.

description: The service was awful. Asked about almond milk creamer and was ridiculed with sarcasm by the cashiers. The barista made me a drip coffee that curdled the almond creamer. He offered to make me another one, only to call me back and say that the same curdling would happen again. I took the coffee black and not surprisingly, it was really sour. It tasted okay to begin with, but left a very sour aftertaste. Way too acidic for my taste. For 5 bucks, plus 1 buck for the almond creamer, this cup was the lamest, most overrated dud of a coffee I've ever experienced. An extra star is given for the decent (albeit overpriced) avocado toast.
author: Barbara J.

description:
Wow! I know they are known for the coffee, but the food I just had here was spot on. Go here for breakfast. Bonus - they are located ten paces away from the Hampton inn back entrance. #convenient
Food: we ordered the avacado toast. This was absolutely amazing! The toast was fresh and crisp, and not greasy. The diced avocado was perfectly ripe, the pickled radish added the extra umph it needed to be memorable and different and it was garnished with sesame seeds and sprouted greens and arranged in a thoughtful heart shape . We also ordered the vegetable salad. This was amazing! It had toasted whole almonds, pickled cauliflower and a dressing that was light and tangy and perfectly seasoned. 
Coffee: My mother ordered a latte with two extra shots (yikes! she's really likes to caffeinate, I'll deal with her later) and I got the mocha latte. They use organic local clover brand milk which is always a ++ in my book, and the mocha was not too sweet or too hot and had nice latte art on top. Seriously don't pass this spot up.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
The coffee I had wasn't that great, it was not very warm and had a strange bitter after taste that I didn't quite like. Besides that it was alright. It also took me around 10 minutes to get my coffee which is like double how long I usually wait for coffee at Special Extra or Philz. People gave really positive feedback of Blue Bottle, but I failed to see it this time. I'll try it again, hopefully it will be better.

I have to admit the environment was really appealing and clean. They served high quality brown sugar which I appreciated and the service was excellent.
author: Christopher L.

description: I think this place is to cool for me...the coffee was good but not great... The baristas weren't as friendly or engaging... I was really expecting to be wowed by the coffee, but it's just ice coffee with milk.
author: Dana M.

description: Blue Bottle has the best lattes I've ever had. The personally made drip coffee is just okay but the espresso based drinks are phenomenal. The milk is so smoothly blended in the lattes and cappuccinos, it's almost like drinking a dessert. I miss when they used the St Benoit jersey cow milk but whole milk latte is still very creamy and delicious. Baristas are warm and friendly unlike the "too cool for school" hipster types at other coffeeshops that will go unnamed. Atmosphere is open with high ceilings, benches for seating and lots of natural light. There's some small tables outside for seating or in Mint Plaza as well. Downside is there's almost always a line. At 9 AM. At lunchtime. At 2:30 PM. At 3 PM. At 4 PM... onwards.
author: Truc N.

description:
This review based on latte ordered.

-* latte taste too sweet.  Vanilla taste.
-* no lids at the counter.  You got to go across the room full of people to get lids.  
-* no sleeves anywhere.  You can get napkins across the room and burn your hands on the way.
-* expensive compare to other coffee shops.

Wanted to like it and to support my local coffee shops.   Unfortunately disappointed.
author: Alex R.

description:
I've heard of this place but other than that I didn't know much about it. I was visiting SF and looking to get some caffeine before dinner. 

We stopped in around 5pm on a Thursday and there were probably about 4-5 people in line. Line moved quickly. It's a nice space with minimal decor. The stools remind me of the stools from science class in high school. 

I ordered a three africas drip (on recommendation by the guy taking my order) and my gf had the oji. The oji was quite good but the three africas left something to be desired...a bit sour/acidic.

The shop was probably about 3/4 full and thinned out as we approached 6pm. Inventory of coffee beans for purchase looked like it was running low. If I were in the area I'd stop in again but not sure if I'd go out of the way. I did not get a chance to try the food that everyone else is talking about.
author: David C.

description:
It was a beautiful morning and I wanted to grab some coffee. Starbucks was the closet but I always love trying other places when I'm in the city so I decided to yelp and Blue Bottle Coffee popped up. I stayed at the Hilton in Union Square so the walk was only 5 minutes. I couldn't believe that there was a line out the door so that must mean it was good? It took me atleast 15 minutes until I got to the register and I decided to order the cafee latte. It then took atleast 10 minutes until I got my order but I didn't mind because anything for some good coffee, right? Yep, sure didn't mind because it was worth the wait! I enjoyed sipping on the yummy latte while walking and then chilling at Union Square. 

They had a breakfast menu but I was really there for some coffee. The inside was pretty small and everyone was pretty much close to each other. It's a cool place to just order to go. Overall, I'll definitely go back again and try something else.
author: Joy L.

description: This was the first Blue Bottle location I went to a few years ago and I have been a loyal customer since! Every time I'm in the Bay Area, I make sure to visit this particular location as I love the historical building with its high ceiling and great location. The coffee here never disappoints and isn't sour at all like some hip coffee shops. If you're looking for a cold coffee, I recommend the New Orleans Iced Coffee as it has milk in it and makes the coffee all that creamier. If I'm looking for something hot, a pour over or latte does the trick!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Most unfriendly batistas and staffs in entire Blue Bottle coffee chain. They must be underpaid. No one ever smiles and greet customers. You can't see any enthusiasm and the brew speed is really slow = reason why you gotta wait so long for a cup of coffee, or why there is a line.

I wish the company pays them little better or train them to be better in service.

I've liked this coffee company so long, it's pain to see their service went down this low.
author: Jun C.

description:
Tried their drip coffee au lait on a rainy day and it was smooth and mellow yet strong. 

The location itself is kind of hard to find. It's in the corner of the business building. It's neat and also busy bustling with hipsters in the morning. Like WOW I couldn't believe I was in the vicinity of so many hipsters all in one space. But I guess coffee brings beautiful people together haha
author: Christine K.

description: Believe the hype! Don't worry about the line. If you are serious about a quality cup of coffee this place is worth the wait and the cost. I am so glad that I stocked up when I was there on some coffee beans, their single pack french press packs and some other goodies! If lived near any of these in the SF Bay area I would be a regular and go out of my way for this coffee!
author: Charlie B.

description:
5 stars for the coffee! They don't have syrups, but you can sweeten with the simple syrup. I got a soy latte. It was tasty enough without any sweetener. The soy probably helped, but I was so proud! It's my first latte without any sweetener! Anyways yummy coffee! No gross coffee aftertaste. Also 5 stars for the olive oil rosemary shortbread cookie! Love rosemary!

Food wise was just alright. My friends and I got the eggs Benedict, poached eggs w/ cornbread and sausage, and poached eggs with ham and tomato sauce over. The eggs were not runny enough, pretty well cooked. It all tasted ok, but not amazing. 3.5 stars ish.

I got two lattes and two of the breakfast items for about $36. Kinda pricey coffee shop meal, but also kinda normal pricing for most places nowadays. 

I would def come back for the coffee!!
author: Kathleen C.

description: Jennifer remembered our order from the previous day... totally blown away!  I was already a huge fan of Blue Bottle, but her amazing customer service just brought the devotion to a whole other level. Keep doing what you're doing!
author: Jenn M.

description:
Blue Bottle has become a tourist destination. There is a line around the block at 9a on the weekends. Coffee is good but expensive. I tried an almond milk latte and it was really good but not $5.72 worth. I also got the overnight oats with chia seeds ($6.50)  which was good but expensive.
Come here if you're in the neighborhood but don't go out of your way!
author: Norah C.

description:
Delicious delicious coffee! 
Definitely worth the hype except its a bit pricey. 
Plus the location is really trendy. I love the gigantic siphons.

Tips:
- About 10 min walk from Union Square
- I noticed an outdoor stand selling Blue Bottle as well. Worth checking out if the lines are too long.
author: Angel C.

description: Excellent Coffee!!! Terrible service. The staff is more concerned with talking to non buying customers than taking orders and stops in the middle of making a latte to have a 5 minute conversation.
author: Kevin C.

description:
After hearing so many great things about Blue Bottle, I was utterly shocked when I tried my soy latte. I'm a big coffee drinker and I always pay attention to the espresso taste when drinking coffee. I don't know whether it was the soy milk that tasted bland or whether it was the espresso, or maybe even both, but it just was not a good drink. The espresso taste was not smooth, it was just a strong bitter espresso taste and I couldn't even finish my drink.  

My friend got a cappuccino (also happens to be a coffee addict) and she wasn't too crazy about her drink either. 

To add to my bad review, and I really hate giving a bad review to Blue Bottle because I was expecting so much out of this place, the location was hard to find parking and the inside was crowded and small. The employees and baristas were not friendly. Usually you expect baristas to be friendly and talkative, but none of them were.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Amazing coffee, amazing spot, cool staff, cool location away from the madness of Union Square. The breakfast dishes they were serving looked delish although we only had a small pastry with our coffees. Go here instead of the crazy cafes in the shopping district.
author: Monica M.

description: Perfect location with the best baristas! Take all my money and give me all the avo toasts!! The toasty bread, the creamy avocado, the fresh lime, the crunchy (I think radish?), and bold sesame seeds...all culminating together for the perfect, texture-rich bite! Paired with a smoky New Orleans cold brew, you can't go wrong! Top it all off with a creamy, dreamy, oh so lovely affogato, and you've got a winning meal! Blue bottle, please come to texas!!!
author: Nazia H.

description:
Yikes, where have I been? 1800+ reviews here on Yelp and I've finally tried out Blue Bottle's coffee. So frequently mentioned as one of the best places to get coffee ever, BB just left me with an "eh" impression.

I got the latte and my friend got the mocha. My latte was okay; strong in brew, but tasted plain in flavor. My friend's mocha was better. Wasn't sweet at all and made of dark chocolate I think? Very unique in flavor though. Portion size to price didn't match up, and all their drink seemed pricey to me. The affogato had already sold out and it was still early in the day.

I visited Memorial Day weekend, so the place was packed and the line got long. What was upsetting was that there was only one cashier and one barista working at the time. Um, why? The sugar container looked dirty, and actually, the entire sugar / lid counter was kind of dirty.

I dunno... I love coffee, but BB didn't impress me too much as a first timer. Maybe it's because I'm a casual drinker and not a connoisseur? I'll come back to try their other drinks, but I'm definitely in no rush.
author: Enari L.

description:
Dare I say best espresso drinks in San Francisco?! GASP.

I surely haven't tried all the coffee joints in SF, but of the dozen or so I have been to, Blue Bottle's espresso taste, flavor, texture, the store's ambiance, and decor - I think my vote is for these guys.

I typically order a Cappuccino at this location which is prepared perfectly - the temperature has been a little low a couple times for my taste, but in general the mixture, ratio, texture, and consistency are all superb.

The one thing I'm annoyed about is that I've asked for the drink in a "for here" mug several times but it ends up in a to-go cup. Not a big deal, and I don't complain since they are usually quite busy, but the experience is different. 

Basically: come here for the espresso, leave with the jitters.
author: David H.

description:
Iced coffee New Orleans style.
Cappuccino.
 

Perfectly not sweet!

They have pastries and cookies also.
 
Mmm,
Recommend
author: Diane H.

description: Great vibe and even better brew! I had a really great experience here and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco
author: Amy C.

description: Great coffee, but it's way too crowded inside. Also, the only gluten free food is oatmeal.
author: Megan N.

description: Just got back to the Bay and I could not go home to El Cerrito without stopping here!  The cappuccino and avocado toast yum :)
author: Pratibha G.

description:
AFFOGATO.

$5.50 for a cooled cup with a scoop of wondrously sweet Humphrey Slocombe blackberry honey ice cream that is brilliantly balanced by the smooth, oh-so-appropriate bitterness of the warm espresso shot (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-7?select=wt30t9hxkBW6UeaT_gjWhw#wt30t9hxkBW6UeaT_gjWhw), with an accompanying spoon for convenient consumption.

The coffee shop uses Square as their payment system, which automatically prompts for tip. It makes your expensive coffee even more expensive (though the service for both the customer and the coffee is worth it).

Don't fogato to order your affogato.
author: Adele F.

description: Coffee aroma! :) however wanted to try  afogato, sold out. Ordered iced coffee New Orleans, where should I sit??  Full house.... and coffee was not a strong one. Not my cup of "coffee".
author: Jane D.

description: Yes yes I know, there is now a location in Venice (LA). No I won't stop coming to the locations in SF.
author: Payal L.

description: Forgot to print out order and had a long wait. Acknowledged they messed up with no hassle and completed our order immediately after and gave us free pastries and cookies. Aside from that, they make an excellent cappuccino and cafe mocha. Good quality coffee shop with friendly and helpful staff.
author: Jon W.

description:
Cheap prices and delicious coffee.

Music was really good, location is really hidden, a place like this needs to be out in the open
author: Eric R.

description:
I'm a fan of Blue. In the neighborhood and craving some caffeine so the two shall meet.
Love the ice coffee or latte's so It's a matter of the moment.
This is a larger location with lots of seating and food options.
Service was fast and efficient, as is always the case.
Enjoy.
author: David H.

description:
After years of hype from my SF friends, this was one of the first coffee places I tried when I moved out here. And boy, did it live up to that hype.

The New Orleans iced coffee is one of the best I've had, with the perfect blend of milk, cane sugar, and that delicious Blue Bottle coffee. As you can see in the picture, it also looks really pretty. 

For breakfast, I also had the thick-cut toast with poached eggs. I was expecting just a few slices of lukewarm bread and some dull-looking eggs, but this was the best damn presentation I've ever seen for simple toast and eggs. Not to mention, everything was finger-lickin' good.

Needless to say, I've been back numerous times and fully intend on coming back in the near future.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Nicely done.
Good latte in real cups, nice food (Tunisian pouches eggs and lemon granola bar) and food stevie.
The location here is also interesting and different.
Recommended
author: A S.

description:
I came here on my trip to SF with my boyfriend! I hadn't heard about it till a friend recommend I go. It was a little hard to find, but it is located within Mint Plaza and a small Blue Bottle is on the sign outside the shop, but otherwise no evidence that a coffee company sits there! 

The line was relatively short as compared to the experience of other yelpers. I got a cappuccino, which was robust & flavorful! I thoroughly enjoyed my coffee experience here, and hopefully will be back if I am in the SF area!
author: Monica S.

description:
The only Blue Bottle Coffee Co location that has the siphon coffee. What is siphon coffee? Look at my photo or on google haha.
My bf and I was walking towards a vietnamese restaurant when we passed by this BBC location. I wanted to take him to Philz but it was far from our current location and destination. On our way back from lunch, we decided to stumble in for a fix of caffeine. We're not coffee experts by any means. I told him I've tried their drip coffees in the Oakland location before and didn't really like it. We gave the siphon coffee a try. Ordered the small (10oz?) for $7 dollars or so. We got our number, sat down right in front of the barista that was making the siphon coffees. It's such a cool experience. Nothing that I've seen before. The coffee was okay, didn't love it. I still think it's on the pricy side for something I don't find delicious.
author: Winnie T.

description:
Ever dream of becoming a regular at a coffee shop? - Yes. All. The. Time.

Finally, the time has come for me at one of the best Blue Bottle locations. Sarah, the most amazing and sweet barista here has made my dream come true. I AM A TRUE REGULAR! She knows me by name and drink! 

But let's face it, being a regular isn't the only thing that brings me back week after week. It's the amazing coffee and pastries. Yes, let's talk about the more important things here. 

This Blue Bottle location uses their 17ft Ceiling espresso blend, and from time to time for an extra $1 you can choose to use one of their other espresso blends, like Hayes Valley or Opascope. My go-to is always the cappuccino! Yummy.

And as your eyes are drawn into their glass box full of pastries and as the line gets closer to the cash register, the decision just gets tougher and tougher. But no worries, get the pretzel knot. It is probably one of the best pastry pretzels I've had! It's perfect texture of chewiness and softness makes the perfect snack with your drink!

And of course, if you aren't already familiar with Blue Bottle coffee, their NOLA is a must try!
author: Winnie I.

description:
This is a really cute cafe in a European looking alleyway just south of Market. The place is only marked by a blue bottle on the exterior wall but you'll notice the crowd before getting there. 

There are some outdoor side walk seats as well as some indoor bar seating and communal seating. You order first at the bar. Good service. I tried the Tahitian vanilla cookie which was pretty good. 

My New Orleans iced coffee was awesome. Refreshing and just what I needed. Rich coffee flavor and the milk flavor was not overpowering at all. 

I can see why people get excited when this chain enters a new market. It is a clean sophisticated space that makes high quality coffee drinks.
author: James W.

description:
There is always a long queue at this place and it is totally justified. After all, people won't queue for some crappy coffee, right? Especially in downtown San Francisco when there are coffee cafes in like every 20 steps.

As I was saying, the coffee was good, and this came from an avid self-confessed black coffee drinker like me. The way they brew the coffee is interesting. They use siphon glass bulb which looks a lot like the thing you use in the chemistry lab. If you sit by the coffee counter, you can see how they create the magic. It's fascinating. They sure put a lot of effort just to get you that delicious cuppa.  

I also noted they use the Oji machine that is known as the best machine for brewing large batches of cold coffee. I made a mental note to try the cold coffee next time I am there.

Oh they serve food too! I had this deliciously warm waffles which was a perfect companion to my coffee. 

Now if only they open a branch in Salt Lake City :-)
author: Zuhadi Z.

description: If you're ok with a snobby response to a request for a flavored latte (they don't have caramel or any flavored syrups, only a grainy-textured chocolate for the mocha) and if you don't mind stepping over the fresh evidence of the homeless residents' active bladders, this is the place for you!
author: Carol N.

description:
I got the single origin iced coffee!! 

PROS: 
Nice decor/ambiance
Great cup design/logo

CONS:
Coffee was the kind of acidic kind (that I do not love)
High price for small cup
Too much ice
Too much people in tiny shop = nowhere to sit!!

It was just OK to me, but I also came in with high expectations due to the overall 4.5 rating from 1500+ people! But I did REALLY enjoy their little cup design hehe. Very cute. And I do enjoy being in hipsterly decorated places if I can sit indoors .. (SF is so cold!!)
author: Diana W.

description:
As a caffeine based life-form and an avid coffee lover, I can say that this place is amazing! No scratch that, epically amazing*. From the service, to the quality of the coffee, all I can say is 'ah, perfection'. I used my 'Yelp-fu' skills to discover this place a few months ago, and I have been coming back here almost every week. The coffee beans are fresh, the food is amazing, and oh dear the affogato - is made from the tears of angels!! Wow I just drooled a little ... no one saw that.

Yeah the line, can be quite long. But totally worth the wait!!!

tldr: amazing place, worth the wait, don't fogato to order your affogato.
author: Xin W.

description:
My favorite of all Blue Bottle locations in San Francisco...this one is located in the beautiful Mint Plaza. Convenient to SoMa and the Union Square area in Downtown San Francisco.  
Expect a line! 

This place is quite popular with your classic San Francisco yuppies and hipsters. Seating is limited, but you should be able to snag a spot if you're coming with no more than 2-3 people.

My favorite drinks here are the New Orleans Iced Coffee and classic Latte. Moderately priced, but the quality is well-worth what you pay!
author: Olivia C.

description:
My office is around the corner, and passing Blue Bottle every day is killing my "Oh, I should stop depending on coffee to get through my day" attitude. 

It is always insanely crowded, but in the mornings they set up a nice little tent in the plaza a few feet away, and that's where I always get my iced New Orleans coffee, which is amazing.

Sometimes I go inside and get a mocha, and that's really good too. And their food? Awesome for a mid afternoon snack.
author: Christina S.

description: Love the coffee from Blue Bottle. It's always fresh and tasty. The service here was quick and friendly. Definitely would go again and visit this one and other Blue Bottles. I love the New Orleans iced coffee. I got to try the Three Africans blend this time and that was really flavorful too. Robust, but still mellowed out on the finish so it wasn't too bitter.
author: Alicia C.

description: New Orleans is good...not as sweet as other renditions, which I like. Fun vibe here too...typical modern, hipster, steampunk coffee geeks.
author: Aaron B.

description:
I was visiting San Fran for a work conference and my co-worker heard about the coffee at Blue Bottle. It was walking distance from the hotel, and maybe that was a bad thing because i walked over every day to get coffee - first, i had the iced, then a latte, then a mocha.  All were delicious, but the mocha was my favorite.
in the back there is what looks like a science lab and you can see them experimenting with the coffee. the music was also chill. it is expensive but the quality is there - definetely a nice treat.
author: Grace R.

description: I love Blue Bottle Coffee's atmosphere at all of their locations! They is always so modern yet comforting. My boyfriend and I got avocado toast and iced lattes. Even though it's a bit expensive, the food and drinks were presented really nicely and I think the quality was worth it. They even offered to remake our drinks since we didn't hear them call our names.
author: Davis F.

description: Knowledgeable and patient staff! Ordered the flavorful iced coffee $4, delicious ham cheese baguette $8, and moist lemon poppyseed cake $4. Plus check out the Blue Bottle cart just outside the permanent location for a quick sip!
author: Cheeky123 C.

description:
As a non-local, my friend found out I was up here in the bay so he asked me to bring back some Blue Bottle Coffee.  I was curious about it so I walked over here, stood in line that reaches out the door at times and ordered a sweetened iced coffee with soy.  I was pleased with it, thought it tasted good.  It reminded me of some low acid coffee I had before.  The double chocolate cookie for $2 made a perfect accompaniment.

The lady at the register was helpful in figuring out which blend to take home.  My only complaint was that there was so much ice in my cup that I finished my coffee not too long after.  If they offered a larger size, I would opt for that but I don't recall being asked.
author: Christine A.

description:
This place gets crowded easily. I love the ambience of this place because they leave the windows open and you get the breeze of bay area. It's really nice to just look out on the street and enjoy your cup of joe with breeze. But I have to admit it gets cold. lol. 
Blue bottle is just quality. Smooth as silk and leaves a nice fragrance in your mouth. Yum!
author: Joanna W.

description:
I will keep it short and sweet: I've been all over the world, and Blue Bottle Coffee Co. has the best coffee I have ever had in my life. Nothing else compares. Skip all the espresso milk-based drinks and just get the single-origin drip coffee. Don't add any sugar or milk -- just drink it black. Trust me. You will be transcended to the next level of coffee enjoyment. 

No need to thank me.
author: A+M M.

description:
Best espresso that I've found in San Francisco so far.  And unfortunately, everyone and every tourist knows it.  There is always a long line that extends past the door, even in the middle of a downpour.  Their lattes are on point.  The steamed milk has the perfect consistency which allows it to hold a beautiful latte art design and the espresso is smooth.  Definitely for the purist, as there are no fancy schmancy syrups or flavored lattes.  But, seriously, this latte doesn't need any sugar.

I have also had their famous iced New Orleans coffee which I thought was okay...sweetened and chicory-filled...but it sort of paled in comparison to their espresso drinks.  I was also really intrigued that this Blue Bottle also offered siphon coffee brewing on a few of their single origin coffees.  The siphon method of brewing offers a much fuller and usually lighter flavor profile.  It is unique in the temperature stability which also produces some flavor notes that other brewing methods do not provide.  The siphon coffee barista or sommelier (as my brother referred to him) was dedicated to just siphon brewing and was very exact in his procedure.  He often used the thermometer and he also hand-delivered each brew with an explanation to the consumer.  Nice touch of service!  I was able to sample two of their coffees brewed this way and I was impressed with the level of attention/care given to each.  The coffees were still a little on the bright side for my liking, but still enjoyable.  Also you get super cute tall glass mugs to drink your siphon brew out of.  A small siphon will serve about 2 cups.  I do want to try their Oji brewed coffee though--the contraption used to brew this coffee definitely looked like something out of a chem lab.

One thing that surprised me was that they serve real food too at this location (not sure if they do this at other locations, too).  But, on Saturday they offered some breakfast/brunch options.  I ordered the sunny side eggs & cauliflower dish which was surprisingly delicious, albeit a bit pricey.  The other food options looked delicious, too and I would return to try some of their other food (if I am up for waiting in line!)

Really, I can't complain about anything here except that my wallet can't afford to try every single thing on the menu (even though I want to!).  Wish they offered latte-making classes...and built a Blue Bottle that was large enough to support the long lines!
author: Jess Y.

description: A hidden gem with some great tasting coffee and a small selection of pastries and foods. I got the New Orleans cold brew. It's got roasted chicory, sugar cane, and milk in it. So good and very smooth!
author: Jessica M.

description: Very tasty coffee, but it is pricey in my opinion. The location is also difficult to figure out. I went for the experience but if the coffee was lower priced I would be a much bigger fan because it is strong, delicious coffee
author: Sam B.

description:
Kinda pricey but the coffee is super cremey    
The staff is nice and friendy and the enviroment is nice.
author: Maggie H.

description:
I agree with other Yelpers when they say it is a pretty penny for this coffee, but boy is it worth it! I got their latte and it was a smooth, roasted taste which is what I look for. I did get to try the New Orleans cold brew and that is heavenly; I can stay awake for 2 days with that coffee if I drank it straight. I would recommend taking sips as it can get you pretty jittery if you gulp too much!

I went during a weekend and the line was fine. It is your standard coffee line wait. They have a little side bar area for standing coffee conversations. Great part is that Octavia is right there.
author: Daizzee P.

description: Been hearing about this place for a while now! Finally got to try blue bottle coffee! I tried the New Orleans cold brew. It was pretty good. The coffee had a different taste to what I'm usually use to. I really liked it. The downside was that it was a bit pricey and not enough space to sit. It's a also a bit crowded as well. If I'm in town again, I'll try blue bottle coffee again, perhaps a different coffee to explore.
author: Milad S.

description:
Hands down- coolest coffee shop I've ever been to! It's like a coffee science lab! No joke! I'd skip work for this place every single day.

Ordered black coffee & seriously couldn't get enough of it! Had such a yummy flavor! :) if I ever come back to SF, I'll be sure to stop here!
author: Kaley L.

description: I had one of the best affogatos here! I fell in love with the drink. The line was way too long and people are in a hurry. I did not have time to order anything else because the place was wayyy to fast paste. I would have loved to sit and relax but it was too crowded. I would like to give it another try when its not too crazy.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Hipster Haven! Why is everyone here so much cooler than us?? 

Great coffee + ambiance at this spot. I tried the New Orleans iced coffee and the boy got the house drip, black. I liked his better. Wish we got one of those cool clear coffee-pot thangs so we could've snapped more awkward photos and stuck out more than we already did :) Tourists... 

Definitely a place to check out if you're in town. Get a seat in front of the counter to get a full Blue Bottle experience.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Nice little Blue Bottle location not too far from Market St. and the Westfield Mall if you're looking for a caffeine stop. It's hidden in a little plaza. Good location for hanging out with a few friends or if you need to get some work done. The coffee is good as always and I also tried their lemonade. Besides the normal lemon and cane sugar, they also used yuzu, which you could definitely taste. Pretty awesome! I'll get that the next time if I don't feel like getting coffee.
author: Clarice C.

description: I love Blue Bottle Coffee! Honestly such delicious flavors - I love the lattes here! Sometimes I don't even like the taste of coffee, but I'm addicted to Blue Bottle. Also, definitely try the chocolate they sell here with Tcho. It's a Blue Bottle Coffee infused chocolate. So good!
author: Caley Z.

description:
Although it now the darling of investment bankers, Blu Bottle has managed to retain some of it's pioneering roots. 
I would give it five stars, but the heart was not well executed.
author: Frank S.

description:
For quality and experience in coffee service, they cannot be beat. I will actively seek out the nearest blue bottle outlet whenever I'm in San Francisco as its a real treat. 

My only complaint is that for their world famous New Orleans style cold brew they serve it as a pre-packaged carton, which is the same you can get at Whole Foods or grocery stores around the world. And while I'm glad I can still get it, I would prefer a more house made option. It's so delicious, but it would be nice.
author: William P.

description: Had the breakfast this time, Avocado toast. Perfect size for a morning pick me up.
author: Natasha B.

description:
Great find on my last day in SF. small but quick don't be scared of the line that may be out the door it moves. Seats open up by the time you order. 
I ordered the coffee cherry toast which was a perfect portion size and delicious. Coffee was equally as good. Definitely stop in if you want a good cup of coffee.
author: Helen W.

description:
The coffee is incredible! I've been to blue bottle several times and it's consistently the best coffee. 

My husband and I hit up the one in the ferry building and get an affogato. 

I've been to the one on Mint street several times this week for coffee and the last two days I ate a full breakfast - waffle with two poached eggs and a latte. This is the best breakfast I've had in a while. 

Warning: they serve the waffle with the butter and syrup already on the waffle. Normally I prefer to dip my waffle in a pool of syrup but they do it just right and ensure every bite is equally delicious! And it's not soggy (otherwise this would have been one star review).
author: Erica S.

description: The New Orleans iced coffee is the best iced coffee that I've ever had. Perfect amount of sweetness and I asked for a little less milk than they usually do.
author: Jennifer H.

description: We are dedicated coffee lovers. This place was highly recommended but proved to be a profound disappointment. The staff were inattentive and got our order wrong. Our Americano Misto and Latte when received we're both lukewarm and quite watery. The coffee flavour was not great. The cleanliness of this joint was sub par with lots of spills and simple syrup stains marking the condiment area. We will definitely avoid this place in future trips to San Francisco!
author: Adrian M.

description: The baristas here know their stuff. I love the coffee and lattes. I would love if they allowed a choice in the drip coffee, sometimes I'm stuck with a blend I'd rather not have. That's really the only downside to this place. Also, there's no wifi, if you're planning on working, and it's usually pretty crowded, but you can usually find seats as long as you don't mind sitting next to strangers. Otherwise, this place is delicious and beautiful and light. And the avocado toast is to die for!
author: Kendall S.

description: Delicious avocado toast with a side of poached eggs. Definitely try their coffee too! Their lattes and affogatos
author: G S.

description:
Nice, small coffee shop with communal seating inside and a few tables outside. They offer standard breakfast foods like waffles and eggs--but you might have to wait a while since they only have one chef on duty! This place does get a bit crowded too so it can be a struggle to find seating. Parking can also be hard since they only have a small lot (accommodating 6-8 cars max) so you may want to consider the parking garage across the street on Mission street. 

I ordered a latte and it was pretty good. I'm not too much of a coffee connoisseur but it's comparable to Temple coffee in Sacramento. My friends had espressos and said they were AMAZING! I might have to try those next time! 

All in all, this is a great place if you want to sit back and catch up with friends. They have clean restrooms (Very important in my book) and the crowd is usually very hipster-like.
author: Steph M.

description: Hipsters' coffee paradise. The menu consists of coffee-related beverages that I've never even heard of, much less am familiar with. Drip coffee wasn't even an option, but i asked for it and it was very good. The building and atmosphere is remarkably unique and definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. If you're a coffee nut this may be your ideal coffee shop, but if you just want black coffee (like me), you can get a lot more coffee for $3 somewhere else that probably tastes exactly the same.
author: Shelby B.

description:
Thank you Blue Bottle Coffee Co. for such a mind blowing experience. 

As a coffee lover I enjoy looking for new places to try coffee.  I've had blue bottle coffee before but not at the actual shop.  I have to say the coffee was superb and my barista did an amazing job on the affogato.  I paired the affogato with the seasonal pumpkin spiced bread and it definitely satisfied my tastebuds. 

The affogato's espresso matched well with ice cream, it didn't taste too sweet but just right as I enjoyed every drip. If I was a savage I would have probably licked the cup!   

The seasonal pumpkin spiced bread was really moist and had a balanced taste. 

Ambiance was nice and simple, loved the high ceilings, and the hipsterish atmosphere.  Location is a bit hidden but it was not hard to find.
author: Anthony T.

description: This blue bottle location is sleek, modern, & open. There is a line everyday but it moved quickly. And no wonder blue bottle is popular, the coffee is wonderful and the staff is fabulous. Stephen in particular greeted us with a smile and welcomed us like we were guests in the city. He listened to my request and didn't roll his eyes but seemed excited to make my dry cappuccino not too dry.  Keep it up blue bottle!
author: Kelly T.

description: This was the first coffee shop I went to when I moved to San Francisco, and that was a really great decision. I got the latte and a breakfast sandwich, both of which were delicious. The sandwich tasted really fresh and crisp. The staff was very personable and sweet. I went another time with my best friend, who is a big coffee connoisseur and loved the place as well.
author: Kremi A.

description: Can't miss it!  Best coffee I've had....pretty much ever.  Their lattes are on point; not too milky
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
Two words that are synonymous with coffee in the Bay Area: Blue Bottle.

I came here a few years back during my first trip to San Fran. and we went to the Ferry Building location, which was good.

I stopped by the Mint St. location during this trip because our hotel was right at Union Square.  The service here is excellent and the baristas are super friendly. 

When I got my soy mocha, I thought it was good, but not amazing.  I tasted more milk and less espresso, which was a bummer.  The drink was creamy, though, which I like, but the milder espresso flavor was the downfall. Overall, I liked Blue Bottle, but I didn't see the need to go again.
author: Monica J.

description:
finally came here after hearing so much about it! prices are not bad for the regular coffee but we decided to get the special coffees on the right side of the menu which are a bit more pricey.

the staff here was extremely friendly, explained the menu and then the person making the coffee even explained to us the whole process they use to make the coffee, pretty damn awesome! definitely would come back to try the other stuff
author: Jon T.

description: Wow. Excellent, excellent, excellent everything. Truly a place to visit for anybody who enjoys coffee.
author: Eric M.

description: At first, we thought this place didn't have much to offer. We were gonna just grab the avocado Toast to share and a latte for me to then leave and some real breakfast. Boy, were we wrong! We went back to order another avocado Toast with a side of poached eggs and bacon and a additional latte! It was amazing! We also ordered the almond toast with jam and that great as well! My only disappointment was the coffee couldn't be hotter. The barista was really great about making a new latte for me but it just wasn't hot enough for my preference but the taste was there... great coffee! Overall I highly recommend this place!!
author: Alana L.

description: Love this place! I love coffee so I always am on the hunt for a good one. There's usually a line whenever I go, but as a coffee addict, I love it so much I can wait for 30 minutes. If you are planning on going, just avoid busy times. Worth it all around!
author: Nick A.

description:
The walnut sugar strudel they have today is great. I also recommend splurging on a cup of kayanza heza (9$ for a small). No sour citrus notes, just rich dark coffee for coffee-heads. They have lots of drip coffees. 
Its hella noisy so not an ideal spot for studying although I do see a nerd w his ipad out. 
They do 5 star acai bowls across the street
author: Rose M.

description:
You know that scene in Jerry Mcguire where it's super emotional and he pours his soul out, ending with that iconic line?!  No, not 'Show me the money'.  Blue Bottle Coffee Co, you complete me.  You make me want to be a better coffee drinker.  

From the moment that I stepped inside, I felt the vibe.  And I liked it!  The place was packed and the baristas were really fast paced.  That being said, the guy at the counter slowed down and switched gears to help this out towner end up with a coffee that would make her return 3 more times during her visit.  Upon recommendation, I ordred a New Orleans style Iced Coffee (Their signature thing) and a Gruyere Pretzel Roll.  The roll was just what I needed for an afternoon snack.  Light, spongy, and filled with heavenly gruyere.  But the coffee was perfection.  I was born and raised in Seattle.  I make my living as a barista.  I would like to think that I know something about coffee.  Take a moment and realize the seriousness of the statement I am about to make.  Best coffee I have ever had.  There I said it!  My future visits, I bounced back and forth between the iced coffee and a Gibraltar (Known as a cortado elsewhere).  The espresso pulls boasted of perfect crema and the drinks were topped with velvety micro-foam, showcasing swirls of beautiful artwork.

Leaving San Francisco was hard, but leaving my newly found and mindly obsessive relationship with Blue Bottle was even harder.  This place is legit.  It's what coffee dreams are made from.
author: Erika S.

description: If you are willing to bear the line, Blue Bottle consistently serves up the best coffee in all of SF. I always get a soy latte, and it is absolutely divine. I crave it all the time. Definitely worth the wait!
author: Paul L.

description:
I was on a quest to find a Blue Bottle Coffee store during my trip to SF as I had read the Blue Bottle book earlier this year. The book definitely piqued my interest in the various styles of coffee and the brewing methods. And, as a Seattleite, I am always on the lookout for good coffee & cafe vibe. 

Anyways, we were staying at The Westin St. Francis and I decided to bypass all the Starbucks in the area to find this location. It was quite the mission. This store is tucked inside an alley and I missed it and walked past to... gasp, the outskirts of The Tenderloins. I hastily turned back and found Blue Bottles in the corner of the alley. 

It was 9am on MLK Day and it was quite packed inside already. The cafe itself is small and had several long tables that people don't mind sharing. I took a glance at the menu and decided on the New Orleans Ice Coffee. I am so glad that I did. It was the perfect blend of coffee & milk with a hint of sweetness. If I live in SF, this would be my go to drink every morning. 

They offer an array of other drinks as well as food. The only thing lacking is wifi... I'm the type who loves to sit at cafes for hours plugged in. Otherwise, this is a must!
author: Wendy L.

description:
COFFEE SNOBS REJOICE!
---
THE DEETS:
- Day 3 of the conference
- In search of a solid cup of coffee
- In need of a deliciously satisfying runny egg
---
ON THE MENU:
- Cappuccino Buena Vista (Nicaragua)
- Sunny Side Eggs & Cauliflower with Heritage Bacon
OVERALL:
- By far one of the best breakfasts I've had in a very long time. It's hard to find a proper cup of cappuccino and after having Blue Bottle's cup of Buena Vista coffee from Nicaragua I knew that I found what I've been looking for. The breakfast paired well with my coffee. It was exactly what I was looking for. A runny egg on toast with a side of bacon. I look forward to the next time I can have this coffee again!

#499
author: Marlyn A.

description:
I only like to get the almond latte...i think they get their almond milk specially made for BB which is pretty cool.

not a big fan of their famous New Orleans Cold Brew - too acidic for me.
author: Sam C.

description:
Great quality coffee if you're tired of Starbucks. It's drip coffee here and they treat their customers with more care here also. I love their Vietnamese Iced Coffee and New Orleans Iced Coffee with their rich bold flavor with that small kick of being sweet. Their hot chocolate is made with the local San Francisco chocolate, TCHO. I work at the hotel across the street and always recommend guests go here instead of Starbucks and they always come back glad they did. They have a small selection of pastries also, but be warned it is quite often they have a line out the door. What's neat is that on their website they have a webcam to show you what the line looks like in case you're working nearby and would like to plan a trip accordingly instead of walking there and deciding to turn back because of the line.

I also decided on a recent trip to try their Affogato. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! Vanilla bean ice cream with a shot of espresso poured on top. The ice cream was delicious, and by the time you get to the bottom of the cup, you get a milkshake-like substance where you can just drink the espresso shot with melted ice cream to get that caffeine high into your system. A great refreshing treat if you're craving something sweet and need some energy. Makes me wish they sold some kind of Blue Bottle Coffee brand ice cream in stores.
author: Cris-ann L.

description:
Nice place to enjoy thick and rich coffee taste with a lively atmosphere. Coffee is quite strong, perfect of you are a lover of italian coffee like I am!
The place is quite hidden and not so big, but is worth to come and change from the usual watery starbucks coffee.
author: Elisa M.

description: Blue bottle on Mint has a perma-line, but it's worth it. The coffee is great and although I haven't eaten there myself i hear the food is good as well. If you're in the area definitely check out this location.
author: Shaun J.

description:
Long lines here for a reason... The New Orleans may not look like much until you take a sip. Chicory & cane sugar goodness! I'd definitely recommend trying their affogato on a hot summers day too.

Their food menu actually looks pretty impressive; I'm going to have to come back for snacks/lunch one day.
author: Sally C.

description: Love it. Well worth the line up. It's tucked away in Mint Plaza, an alley that triangulates street peeps, business types, and high end shoppers with relatively few tourists. Gorgeous decor and delish delectables. Coffee is better onsite - I took a few bags home as gifts and find it too bitter on regular machines. Blue Bottle needs to be quaffed on site.
author: Be F.

description:
I've been wanting to try the coffee here ever since trying Gelateria Naia's Blue Bottle coffee gelato. I'm happy I was able to try it because the coffee here is truly amazing. I got the New Orleans Iced Coffee from the recommendation of other Yelpers and it was delicious. It's one of the best iced coffee drinks I've had. Apparently, the New Orleans Iced Coffee is brewed with Chicory, which gives the coffee a deeper and less bitter flavor. It was rich, refreshing, and delicious and I would definitely get it again. 

I'm knocking a star because the coffee is expensive. The seating is also limited, the lines can be long, and the place is tucked away in a corner off of mission st so it's a little hard to find. However, the atmosphere of this place and the service is great and they also offer breakfast, lunch, and brunch! I'm definitely coming back to try out the food and different types of coffee.
author: Hana K.

description:
I would blue bottle it all the time.  So tasty, so perfect, so consistent..never a weird aftertaste or the smell/taste of overly roasted beans.  

C'mon Blue Bottle, bring a little love to the islands...
author: Janet Y.

description:
Walking down mission towards The Mint Plaza wasn't the most enjoyable walks I've since being in the city. Life without a car in a strange city can be exciting and terrifying and cosmically colliding. I wanted to go to the original BBC, but the further down Mission I walked towards 6th then 7th became darker - the back flow of sewage water stunk. And yes you guessed it right... I missed the turn onto Mint Street - across from San Francisco Chronicles / before Mary St. 

Inside Blue Bottle coffee was simple and brightly lit. High wooden long tables and friendly staff greeted us. 

New Orleans Iced Coffee: cold brew and served with cold milk. A cup that reminded me of the touch of cold silk on a hot summers night. It was refreshing and luxurious. 

Latte: Rich and bold brew over au lait. Something warm and a little more filling to last a good conversation...
author: Nancy W.

description: This is my favorite Blue Bottle location! I think most of the Blue Bottles are consistent, but this one is most consistent. I always get either a latte or the New Orleans cold brew. Lattes have good espresso:milk ratio, and cold brews are flavored smoothly. This location is definitely one of the busiest Blue Bottles I've been to, but worth it to check out.
author: Steph V.

description: Absolutely fantastic coffee shop!  Makes Starbucks look super lame and overpriced.  I had a great hot chocolate and waffle...possibly the best breakfast I have ever had!  You might find a line here, but it's well worth the wait!
author: Matt E.

description:
Who doesn't love Blue Bottle Coffee?

This place is poppin' with the lines going out the door. The location is unusual, but it's pretty cute and kind of isolated from the crowds. Coffee is always good here and service was great!
author: Kristy K.

description:
Ordered the Bella Donovan: 
"DAMN!" (Coffee can taste this good?)

Also had an apple + brown butter cake:
"Pffffftt... I need 12,000 of these."

The staff are also welcoming, and treated me like a friend:
"What are you doing later, Mike?" 

This place is great!
author: Nick S.

description: BOMB molasses ginger cookie. Mm. Yummy light coffee. The line moves fast so don't be intimidated to wait.
author: Natasha K.

description: The hype is real, one of the best coffees I´ve ever had. The milk in my latte was foamed perfectly, like it came from heaven. Can´t wait to come back!
author: Fede R.

description:
I read all of the review for Blue Bottle.  I had high expectations on the service and on the product.  First of all, the guy that helped me was extremely rude.  I had a few questions about some of their brews, and he gave me answers that made me feel unappreciated and demeaning.  

I ordered their cold brew, and honestly, I didn't love the coffee.  The coffee is definitely more on the earthy side and I honestly did not like the coffee at all.  The location is in a weird place and was a little difficult to find at first, but with a little looking around, I located the store.  

I personally enjoy Philz coffee a lot more.  If you're not into earthy coffees, I would pass on Blue Bottle.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Why 5 stars? Because this is possibly the best coffee in the world.

   ---   ---   ---

I am kind of embarrassed and ashamed that I previously rated this 4-stars. I caved under Yelp peer pressure and got the New Orleans iced during my first visit.... because it seemed like all the cool kids were doing it.

I honestly kind of hated it. I didn't see much appeal at all, but still gave Blue Bottle 4-stars because the food was good and I dug the vibe.

During my return visit, I went with a good ole' fashioned latte. I

I try to keep my Yelp reviews PG-13, but...

Holy.

Shit.

How does coffee taste this good? I want to buy a pool, and fill it with Blue Bottle latte. It's just INSANELY better than any other coffee ever made.* 

Even when I buy beans and bring them home, they are SO much better than anything else that's been created on Earth.

I'll be in SF in March... and you can bet I will be at Blue Bottle every morning during my visit. I will cry when I eventually have to fly home, and return to my Keurig.

*I hate to even say this, but when I was in New York recently, I was able to try Stumptown Coffee and it was very comprable to Blue Bottle**

**The people that work at Blue Bottle Mint Street*** have been great during each visit, but the girls that worked at the BB in NYC (Chelsea) were incredibly rude for no reason. That being said, this coffee is good enough that I would let Satan serve it to me.

***I have been to Blue Bottle 3 different times in 3 completely different months, and each time, I am rung up by a girl that looks a helluva lot like Amy Schumer. I wonder if she's as funny.
author: Brett N.

description: Solid and worth the wait and the extra $
author: Aaron H.

description:
Blue Bottle was great. Sure it's chain-y, but by all accounts, a San Francisco coffee staple. On both visits, wife got a regular latte, which was great both times.

First visit I got the NOLA iced coffee. Honestly I don't get the craze behind it, but I was not a fan. Second day I got a cappuccino and it was marvelous. Must visit for those in the bay.
author: Ishtiaque H.

description: Came here after a tiring day of apartment hunting and I'm so glad I did! The coffee was strong, but not overly so, and it was the perfect pick me up after an exhausting day. Definitely better than your local Starbucks or Coffee Bean! The cashier was also super patient as I was thinking about what to get. Wish I had more time to sit down and truly enjoy the coffee, but I guess I'll do that the next time I come by!
author: Trisha V.

description:
Nice place. Pretty good. I ordered the Tunisian Baked Eggs and it tasted delish. The portion was a little short for the appetite and for the price. Ingredients taste fresh and flavorful. The staff was cordial and welcoming.
Tried their house brew and was gooood. 
Definitely gonna come back.
author: Uber D.

description: Recommend the New Orleans iced coffee as the beverage to try if you're unsure what to get. It's slightly sweetened, creamy, and the coffee flavor is excellent. The line was out the door, which is supposed to be normal on a daily basis, but the line did take about 20 minutes, which wasn't quick. Should have had two cashiers. Cool experience.
author: Lo W.

description:
My first review for the coffeeshop I've waited 2 years to visit! 

This place was a bit hard for me to find because it was my first time here, but it's located at a little corner away from the big streets - quite peaceful without the traffic sounds and smells. There are not TOO many people around 4pm on a Friday, but there is still a decent-sized crowd.

It was a bit hot today, so I got the New Orleans Iced Coffee and the Meyer Lemon Buckle.

New Orleans Iced Coffee:
Prior to coming here, I had tasted the carton version, which I thought was just okay. However, the one served fresh here today was amazing. Though I'm lactose intolerant, I went ahead with the regular Clover milk, because I'd read that soy milk gives the coffee an off-setting taste. I don't regret doing so at all! It's got a smooth, full/rich tasted, and is not acidic at all. 5/5 for this drink.

Meyer Lemon Buckle: 
Honestly did not know what to expect when I got this...I'm not a big fan of this. It's somewhat spicy and bitter. Kind of reminds me of incredibly bitter cumquat soup my grandma used to make me when I was sick. The texture of the cake and crumble on top is on point, but I just didn't really like the taste. 3/5 for this cake.

I was disappointed to find that the poached eggs on toast everyone has been talking about wasn't offered, but it's okay. The employees are very chill; ambience is perfect and nice natural lighting inside the store.
author: Eileen W.

description:
This Blue Bottle shop is super hipster and lively. Treating myself to Blue Bottle on an early Saturday morning is the best way to start the day! 

I complimented my order of the Popeye Eggs baked in Acme Toast with a cup of iced coffee, New Orleans Style. My bf ordered the Eggs baked in Tomato Sauce (with cornbread, smoked gouda and creme fraiche). We were not disappointed!! 

There are seats indoors and outdoors. The only downside would be the swarm of people that come here on Saturdays, making it difficult to find seats. But, food is great, people are friendly, and coffee is the best. Blue bottle is the highest end!
author: Connie L.

description: Quite possibly the best latte I've ever had. Smooth, with perfect foam. I was hesitant at the wait (a line around the corner), and the over-the-top hipsterness of it, but had heard such good things that figured it was worth a try. And oh boy, am I glad I did. Well done, Blue Bottle, well done.
author: Malia C.

description:
While our group was waiting in line for Dottie's True Blue Cafe my friend suggested that we get coffee so off we went. Of course there is a line for Blue Bottle as well. However, the line moved a lot faster and we managed to order our lattes on the go.

First taste and I was in heaven. There is no other word besides perfect to describe my plain latte. No wonder they don't have that many flavors since their coffee is a star. The only regret is that I didn't go back to get some of their beans. I will have to make it out here if I'm in the area again.

Also apparently they serve brunch as well. I'm not so sure I would wait in line just to get food. There are just way too many people so this is a better grab your coffee and go place.

Check out their interesting drip coffee station.
author: Jingwen Y.

description: Update: New line formation with menu placed in front for customers to check out. New bar with 5 siphon decks. Same quality taste and prices!
author: Allister D.

description: The long lines were worth the wait. Wondering what the big deal was until I took the first sip of my latte. Smooth, almost chewy and very tasty.
author: Rob A.

description:
A bit crowded, but a great place to get some work done. There's guest Wi-Fi available from a nearby guest network. 

5-stars because the guy who was helping me out was super chill. 

Oh, and the coffee was okay, I guess.
author: David J.

description:
Some of the employees they've had at this blue bottle this year, I can't even believe how they got the job in the first place. 

This morning they made me wait 25 minutes for a coffee and the girl who made it gave me such an attitude I walked out without my $5 coffee. It's 7:30 on a week day. Come on. So glad I gave them that extra 25% tip. Even though it's the closest coffee shop, I don't think I'll be coming back anymore.
author: Liz F.

description:
My cousin from SD heard about the hype and really wanted to try it so we went.. The night of the tree lighting and the protest apparently. Such great timing, man. Ah well, let's go to the review! 

If you're worried about parking, just drive right into the little alley and have someone double park (wish we knew this earlier because my cousin and I got out two blocks down and walked over while our other cousin circled the block through the bumper-to-bumper traffic). There's also a small lot if you're lucky.

Three items:

New Orleans ice coffee: flavorful (from what I can remember) but not as crazy amazing as everyone says it to be.

Macchiato: no comment. You'll know why in the third item.

Affogato: Sooo this is the reason I don't have much to say about the other two. This was my order and we all agreed I made the best pick -- I didn't even know what it was. Ice cream (vanilla bean?) and coffee? That is my favorite combination. So rich and strong and sweet, that's probably why when I tried the macchiato, it was bitter and ... I didn't like it. I only took one sip of the New Orleans before indulging into this. I'd definitely come by for it again. Or maybe give the others another chance. We'll see, most likely the former :P 

Very chill atmosphere.  We went almost close to closing so it was empty with no lines (thank goodness). And it's so close to the shopping center, totally worth the stop to try if you're in the area.
author: Lisa L.

description: I was in SF for work and knew I wanted to stop by Blue Bottle. There's one right by my office so I stopped by on my way to work. Yes, it was crowded, but the latte I had was worth the wait. The space is beautiful - I could have spent all day there. The latte was delicious, rich and creamy with beautiful coffee flavors. It's not that much more expensive than hitting up your nearest Starbucks, so it's definitely worth a visit. I hope to visit again so I can try the cold brew.
author: Katy L.

description: Super trendy full of fashionistas, hipsters and even more normal folks like me:) all united for their love of caffeine with a nice touch of good design. Tall ceilings, shop in a corner, people standing... it is definitively not your usual Starbucks. Follow the Blue bottle sign outside or you can pass without noticing. You wont regret.
author: Carmen V.

description: Loved their coffee and pastries! Their egg Benedict were yummy too! Cozy and casual ambiance with a window viewing street. Would recommend it for breakfast and coffee!
author: Peg A.

description:
Coffee is legit. Pastry selection is low and pricey! That's what you get in SF I suppose. 
I love their orchid arrangements. Adds to the simple modern atmosphere of the place.
author: Stella H.

description: Not the type of place I believe in.  45min wait for a coffee that isn't special. Not their fault that some people crave that but to me it's a value based rating and it gets one star for the collective experience.
author: Jake T.

description:
Nice place, good coffe and they have espresso also!!!
Perfect to have some relax time specially during sunny days thank to the out-of-the-box desk and outside tables.
Service is good but with only downsides to the person in charge at the cash register does not win ' the prize never sympathy or kindness e specially when you ask some that is hard reply (without Yes or no). BTW as it is my last day in sf and is sunny day: 5 stars done!
author: Max G.

description:
This place - beyond amazing.

I've always heard Kona coffee is the best coffee and for the price and quality, I have to strongly disagree. Blue Bottle is the best coffee.

For the price, quality and flavor it's hard not to love this coffee.

I was first introduced to it in Atlanta, my friend recently moved to SF and sent me a care package which contained Blue Bottle Coffee. So, when I visited her in SF, I had to go and experience this place and all of it's glory.

The fresh brews are amazing along with their staff.

Do yourself a favor and have a cup of joe here. You'll coffee taste buds will never be the same after.
author: Nichole K.

description:
Came here on a wed afternoon around 3pm. Still a wait to get coffee! Crazy! 

Strictly for coffee lovers and those of you with a sweet tooth. 

Tried the New Orleans iced coffee! Loved it! Added some sugar and it was perfection. You can actually taste the coffee which is a win for me. 

I probably won't go out of my way for it but if I'm near a location then I'll be back :)
author: Kim T.

description: If you like a smooth not too sweet mocha this place is perfect. Also the affogatto I may have misspelled that (espresso over ice cream) is addictive, so proceed with caution. Definitely coming here daily if not twice daily while I'm in SF!!!
author: Tina S.

description: i like their sandwich with black Americano right before to the office in the morning.
author: Amanda Z.

description: I've had it in NYC and SF now and I just love it every single time. Their New Orleans cold brew is amazing and I once had this strange lavender/blueberry buckle type thing but it was amazing (It started my obsession with lavender flavored things). I looooove blue bottle like it's my own child.
author: Carli V.

description:
My favorite spot for Coffee when I'm in SF!  Everything I have ordered here exceeds my expectations.  COFFEE is top notch, but also serve awesome yogurt with granola and even their oatmeal is fantastic.

Blue Bottle is full of friendly employees that care about quality coffee and breakfast.

PLEASE OPEN A LOCATION in SAN DIEGO!  Please!!!!
author: Joel M.

description:
The coffee is a given. The location is a hidden gem in a land otherwise dominated by Starbucks. The food is unsuspecting, but delicious.

If you're looking for your caramel macchiatos and peppermint mocha frappes, this is not the place. If you're a coffee connoisseur or even just enjoy a good, strong cup of coffee, then you'll quickly realize why it's very much worth standing in line at Blue Bottle.

The classic drip coffee is the way to go. Why alter the taste of a perfectly awesome tasting coffee bean roast by overwhelming it with milk froth, etc? I ordered the poached egg with piquillo pepper cornbread, and it was absolutely delicious. The dish definitely took a good 20 minutes, so make sure you have plenty of time to deal with the crowd and wait in line.

I love that in addition to the indoor seating, they've now got some high-top tables outside along the side of the building.
author: Mansi A.

description: Great place for a quick bite! I stopped by for a Coffee Sticky Bun, an Almond Cornmeal Cookie, and a Chocolate Chocolate Cookie. The cornmeal cookie was a bit dry and not very sweet. The sticky bun was amazing and so was the chocolate cookie- decadent yet not overpowering. I would definitely go back for those two treats!
author: Sneha K.

description:
As good as it gets.  

The macchiato here is perfect:  rich, strong and complex, with lots of crema and a thick, foamy head, served in a proper porcelain cup.  

For iced coffee, the New Orleans is a distinctive treat, different from what you'd get elsewhere:  coffee and chicory, plus a fair amount of milk and some sweetener, all combined to give an exceptionally smooth drink.  It is bit on the light & sweet side; if you prefer your iced coffee darker, the Kyoto is also very good.

I like the ginger molasses cookie - very fresh and chewy, with plenty of ginger zing.

The space is light and airy, and the tall, open windows let in plenty of fresh air.  And, as an added bonus, no Wi-Fi, so the limited seating actually turns over at a decent pace.

Side note:  I get my beans for home by mail-order from Blue Bottle.  I've tried Stumptown, Intelligentsia, La Colombe, Counter Culture, Gimme! and a few others, but of that esteemed group, I like Blue Bottle's best.
author: Scott H.

description:
Usually, this is a great place to get a good coffee and a tasty pastry. The lines are long for a reason, but lines should advance and it shouldn't take 10 people 20 minutes to order coffee.
After 20 minutes of the line hardly moving, I just gave up.
author: Isaac K.

description: Cool location, a hidden gem. Fast line and very good coffee. Hubby ordered the Japanese cold coffee and loved it.
author: Arely F.

description:
I only get to come here once in a while when I make it into the city, but the coffee, service, and food items here are consistently excellent.

This time, I only had drip coffee (black) and oatmeal with cream and jam. The drip coffee was expertly prepared and served hot. The oatmeal was the steel-cut variety and was just enough to serve as a hearty breakfast without being too much. 

This location does get crowded, and the line is often out the door and around the corner, so be prepared for a bit of a wait. If you just want coffee, it looks like they sometimes have an "express tent" just outside the door and across the alley where you can pick that up pretty quickly and not have to wait in line with the people who are also ordering food.
author: Doug B.

description: Three Africans cold brew was disgusting we could not finish the drink. I'm not sure if it was the batch but it had a strange taste at the end I cannot describe. Other than that the New Orleans was great and cappuccino delicious. Grab their ginger cookie if you are a big fan of ginger. There are actually pieces of I think candied ginger in the cookie.
author: Yoomi C.

description:
I think I have finally come to terms with just because something is popular and trendy doesn't mean it is the best. The almond milk latte is nothing special.
I think peets make better lattes or go to Phils. 

I mean why do I find myself waiting 30 minutes for a latte. Because it's the cool thing to do but I have learned my lesson.  If you are ordering food expect it to take a lifetime. Literally 30 minutes plus. 

I won't knock those poached eggs and acme brioche with jam tho that shit is legit.
author: Tara T.

description:
Ahh! I feel so bad giving blue bottle 3 stars considering I was so excited to try it! But anyways, take my review with a grain of salt since I like my coffee sweet. SWEET! I prefer Philz coffee, sweet and creamy and so blue bottle, although is great coffee, isn't the place for me to go out of my way to get. However, I'm sure my boyfriend would LOVE it since he loves black coffee. I'll take him here one day.

I'll come back and try something else. New Orleans wasn't sweet enough and even though I added more simple syrup, I wanted it more creamy!! I know, blasphemy..
author: Angela K.

description: This place definitely has the hipster atmosphere for coffee shops. I have been here twice and have gotten their mocha and new orleans iced coffee. It was fairly expensive, and the taste was very different than the coffee I was used to. So it was hit or miss. I persoanlly didn't think it was that special, but I definitely know a lot of my friends are huge fans of it.
author: Andy A.

description: This is the best coffee shop I've ever been to. The cappuccino was fantastic, it lasts all day. The poached eggs & toast were great too. The service is excellent. Even the bottled water is good. After a night out in San Francisco, this is the breakfast of champions. I ate it both mornings I was there. I would definitely go back. Yes the location is a bit sketchy, but it is definitely worth it
author: Brent M.

description:
This is the blue bottle flagship.  It is crowded inside.  I can't imagine how people eat here.  It has a cool vibe though, and the wait for drinks isn't that long once you have gotten through the intimidating line.  They have water available right after you've gotten by the cash register. 

The siphons look cool.  I want to try them sometimes. 

The coffee is worth the wait and the crowd. 

This place makes the mint plaza hip. 

They have a coffee cart outside for simpler drinks.  I have not tried that one yet. 

It feels like a tech crowd. 

I prefer the ferry building and Hayes locations, but this one is a convenient walk from Powell.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Hmmm. O_o 

Didn't leave my heart here...

Best believe the hype? Nope...the hype threw me off as I'm unfortunately not in sync with most reviews. Ok, I'm no coffee expert or professional connoisseur, but I sure can tell the lack in deep flavors and the heartiness in a cup of joe. Not to say that the experience was darn awful, but for its stature and cost, the java was just mediocre at best. Or maybe I was just too excited that hoping for exceeding expectations ended up in disappointment? Having to try Intelligentsia, Stumptown, Lammil, and Lavazza, the coffee here has alot of work cut out for 'em. I may have possibly visited on an off day, so I shall return when I'm back in town. But a second chance is maybe all you get. Now show me what you're made of!

Cups:
Cafe Mocha - Watered down chocolate drink. Bleh. 1/5
Giant Steps - Dark blend drip with hints of nut and chocolate. Comforting and yes, the highlight of the visit. 4/5

Ambience:
Industrial loft feel. High ceilings. Noisy and cramp. Uncleaned tables. 3/5

Service: 3/5
Too busy. Possibly short staffed? Unorganized system as everyone was cramped around the register. 

Parking: 3/5 
Public parking structures in the vicinity for a cost. 

Tip. Stick with the drips.
author: Clarence M.

description: Blue Bottle is seriously great. In SF there's an obvious gap between excellence & sub-par, in this case BB & Starbucks. Coffee culture is just beginning to boom in this city and BB is at the forefront. This branch has by far the friendliest and most knowledgeable staff I have come across. They make you welcome, take a lot of care in the product and make sure you're enjoying the experience. Coffee isn't just a job for them, it's a way of life, visit them to see for yourself.
author: Chris K.

description: They're located inside Heath Ceramics with ample seating and a decent selection of coffee and cold brew. it's a little bit off the beaten path if you're in the Mission District but it's adjacent to some modern buildings. I had the New Orleans cold brew and it was very tasty. it wasn't too strong or too sweet, the right combination of coffee and milk. check out Heath Ceramics while you're there, they have a neat selection of kitchenware and books.
author: Mario C.

description:
Next level pretentious - my pinky is permanently stuck in the extended position...

Tried the Nel and the siphon made coffee and was not disappointed despite the fact that neither coffee tasted like anything that i'd prefer to drink on the daily basis.

Based on the brief conversation I had with the guy serving our coffee, Nel shouldnt even be considered in same category as coffee - the analogy he used was - "its like what port is to wine" which makes sense. Having said that it was strong, and impressively fruity with sour notes - which normally i'd dismiss it as being too acidic but at 10$ per order I have no choice but say "refined".  

The siphon made coffee was likewise more acidic than id normally prefer but I'll blame the roast and the beans for that rather than the preparation method, and will add a small disclaimer that although it was more acidic than i'd like it lingered less and was more interesting than your average overly acidic coffee.

If you're a foodie or a coffee snob - do not pass go, do not collect $200 go directly to Blue Bottle and get a nel.
author: Oleg H.

description:
First off the location seemed a bit sketchy for me. If it wasn't for the wonderful experience we had it would be a 4star.
My boyfriend and I are the type of people that like to explore different coffee cafes instead of the chain shops (dont get me wrong convenience and taste of them are still great they just get boring).
We decided for our anniversary we would visit the city and we had heard a lot about the blue bottle but never actually been there. I am so glad we did!
When we arrived there was limited parking but that didn't surprise us one bit considering its sf (there is never parking there). Surprise to us though we found someone pulling out of a spot right outside and nabbed it. 
It's such a nice little place and I love the openness of the tall windows where you can look outside. It was a little loud and crowded at one point but not enough to make me want to leave. We ordered our drinks me (affogato) him (iced new Orleans) and both got a fruit buckle. Omg for one the buckle was amazing! And when I got my drink I had to fight for it with my boyfriend. I've always been a pick espresso person but dam that is the best I've EVER had.
And to make our experience all the more interesting we were treated to a little show of how they make coffee using the burners, definitely cool.
author: Chelsie B.

description: Love this coffee! Popular spot so there may be a short wait. The almond latte is wonderful and has a great taste. Up there with my favorite lattes. Highly recommend!
author: Cheyenne L.

description: Found this place on yelp during a weekend trip to SF. Had cappuccinos and they were amazing. Staff was friendly too. Id recommend buying some beans too while you're there!
author: Looloo D.

description:
